* The rotary-wing system consists of magnetic suspension rotary-wing wheels, an electromotive ring, a magnetic suspension shaft, and a magnetic suspension guide rail. The magnetic suspension rotary-wing wheels are suspended in the space restricted by the electromotive ring, magnetic suspension shaft, and magnetic suspension guide rail using magnetic suspension radial and axial bearings.
* The magnetic suspension rotary-wing wheels and the electromotive ring, along with the magnetic suspension shaft, form a magnetic suspension electric engine. The electromotive ring controls the changes of the current flowing in it according to the electromagnetic conversion principle and generates a rotating magnetic field, which pushes the rotation of the magnetic suspension rotary-wing wheels.
* The design of the rotary-wing suspension structure avoids contact and friction between the high-speed rotary-wing and the interior of the saucer shell, reducing noise, vibration, and improving motive power conversion efficiency and safety.
* The invention includes two improvement solutions: coaxial axial and radial dual magnetic suspension electromotive rotary-wing systems, which overcome the problem of reactive torque and enable stable and easy power control of the rotary wing.

<summary>

- The present invention concerns streptavidin muteins with improved binding affinity for peptide ligands, produced by mutating specific amino acids in streptavidin.
- The mutations are located in the region of amino acid positions 44 to 53 of wild type-streptavidin.
- The streptavidin muteins have a higher binding affinity for peptide ligands than wild type-streptavidin.
- The invention also includes methods for producing, purifying, and using the streptavidin muteins.
- The streptavidin muteins can be used in various applications, such as affinity chromatography, ELISA, and fluorescence titration.
- The invention provides streptavidin muteins with a binding affinity that is at least a factor of 5, preferably at least a factor of 10, and more preferably at least a factor of 20 higher than wild type-streptavidin for peptide ligands.
</summary>

Additionally, the text describes the use of streptavidin muteins in affinity chromatography, ELISA, and fluorescence titration, as well as the production of streptavidin muteins on a preparative scale. The text also mentions the use of streptavidin muteins in a reagent kit and their application in various fields, such as molecular biology and protein purification. The text also provides the nucleotide and amino acid sequences of various streptavidin muteins and their corresponding wild type sequence.

* The text describes methods for forming substituted guanidines using nickel catalysts.
* Nickel catalysts, preferably in the zero oxidation state, are derived from nickel-boride alloys, nickel-phosphide alloys, aluminum-nickel alloys, nickel on kieselguhr, and nickel on silica/alumina.
* Suitable guanylating agents are thioureas and isothioureas, with at least one R group being a protecting group, such as Boc, Cbz, or arylsulfonyl groups.
* The reactions are carried out at room temperature or under ambient conditions in a solvent system, preferably DMF, THF, DMSO, or water.
* The reactions with a nickel catalyst and a thiourea as the guanylating agent result in a yield of at least 85% after 30 minutes, while reactions with an isothiourea as the guanylating agent result in a yield of at least 85% after 2 hours.
* The methods can be used to synthesize N-substituted and N,N-disubstituted guanidines from bis-protected thioureas, as well as mono-, di-, tri-, and tetrasubstituted guanidines from N-protected thioureas.
* The nickel catalyst promotes guanylation reactions by coordinating with the divalent sulfur of thiourea and undergoing oxidative insertion into the carbon-sulfur double bond to form a three-membered cyclic intermediate, which then yields the guanidine and a hydrido nickel(II) complex.

• The present invention provides an apparatus and method for continuously conducting an anodic oxidation and electrolytic coloring of an aluminum strip or wire without requiring a large amount of electrical energy.
• The method involves anodizing the aluminum strip or wire to form an anodic coating, then electrolytically coloring the oxide coating in an electrolyte containing a specific acid or metal salt.
• The anodic oxidation bath composition includes an aqueous solution of sulfuric acid and optional additives, while the electrolytic coloring bath contains at least one of a nickel salt, cobalt salt, copper salt, tin salt, or selenious acid.
• The aluminum strip or wire is passed continuously and successively through the baths, functioning as an anode in the anodic oxidation bath and a cathode in the electrolytic coloring bath without direct connection to a power source.
• The thickness of the oxide film formed in the anodic oxidation bath influences the color obtained in the electrolytic coloring bath, with thicker films producing deeper colors. The current density and electrolysis time in the electrolytic coloring bath are controlled by the area of the aluminum strip or wire immersed, the amount of electric current applied, and the period of immersion.

* The text describes a process for assembling a DNA sequence of interest in plants using site-specific recombination between two or more precursor vectors.
* The process allows for the optimization and identification of a desired DNA sequence for stable nuclear transformation, which can be combined with plant transformation as a one-step procedure.
* The choice of a suitable promoter for the recombinase is important for the efficiency of the assembly process.
* The vectors can be delivered to plants using various methods, including Agrobacterium-mediated delivery or particle bombardment.
* Different plant species may require different transformation techniques, and the choice of method depends on the species to be transformed.

• The present invention relates to a swash plate type compressor with a fluorocarbon coating on the swash plate's facial and end surfaces to reduce frictional wear and increase durability.
• The coating is a heat curable, cross-linked coating comprising a polyfluoro elastomer bonded directly to the aluminum, a lubricious additive, and a load bearing additive.
• The coating allows the use of low silicon alloy aluminum without the need for metal plating or high finish polishing.
• The coating is applied in an aqueous spray and cured in an oven at an elevated temperature, and the piston shoe can also be coated for additional low friction properties.

• The present invention provides novel polymers suitable for use in anti-reflective coatings for semiconductor devices, specifically for use in photolithography processes using 193 nm (ArF) and 248 nm (KrF) light beams.
• The polymers are designed to absorb light strongly at specific wavelengths and can be prepared using reaction equations involving polyhydroxystyrene resin, diazonaphthoquinone halide, and an amine in a solvent. The resulting polymers form a cross-linked structure when hard-baked, allowing for the formation of a spectroscopically stable organic anti-reflective coating material. The polymers have proven to be effective in increasing product yield and preventing CD variation in the formation of submicro-patterns in semiconductors.

* The invention relates to a white, flame-retardant, UV-resistant, thermoformable, oriented film made from a crystallizable thermoplastic with a thickness of 10-350 μm.
* The film comprises at least one white pigment, at least one flame retardant, and at least one UV absorber, and has good orientability and thermoformability, as well as excellent optical and mechanical properties.
* The film can be produced cost-effectively and passes fire tests to DIN 4102 Part 2 and Part 1, and the UL 94 test.
* The film has high UV resistance, maintaining its color and mechanical properties after prolonged outdoor use.
* The film can be thermoformed without predrying and is suitable for a wide range of applications, including interior decoration, exhibition stands, displays, placards, protective glazing, lighting, shop fitting, promotional items, greenhouses, roofing systems, external cladding, protective coverings, construction, and illuminated advertising profiles.
* The invention also includes a process for producing the film using masterbatch technology and precrystallization or predrying.

• The text describes various examples of producing 143a (1,1,1-trifluoroethane) using different catalysts and conditions.
• CrF3 and Cr/Ni/AlF3 catalysts were used to hydrofluorinate 142b (1,1-difluoro-1-chloroethane) with high conversion (100%) and selectivity (100%) for 143a.
• The catalysts were tested under various conditions, including different temperatures, contact times, and feed compositions, and showed good performance and durability.
• The text also describes the removal of low levels of olefinic materials (1130a, 1131a, and 1132a) from 143a using hydrofluorination in the presence of HCl.
• The process can be carried out in a separate fixed bed post-reactor without distilling HCl or HF from the crude product, using the same catalyst as the main reactor but at a lower temperature.

<summary>
• The text describes an improved process for the deacylation and desulfurization of a compound having the formula: ##STR3##
• The process uses hypophosphorous acid to improve product yield and reduce impurities.
• Pyrazolotriazoles are useful magenta couplers for photographic products but are difficult to synthesize.
• The preferred synthetic route involves preparation of triazolothiadiazines and their desulfurization to pyrazolotriazoles.
• The desulfurization process has two steps: a ring contraction reaction and hydrolysis/desulfurization.
• The first step is clean but the second step generates unwanted impurities, including thione and disulfide, which interfere with subsequent reaction steps and can be detrimental in photographic systems.
• The use of hypophosphorous acid in the desulfurization process reduces the amount of these impurities and increases product yield.
• The process is straightforward and economical to carry out and provides several advantages, including the formation of H2S instead of sulfur and the lack of reduction of nitro groups or other functional groups.
• The invention includes preferred embodiments for the preparation of 3,6-disubstituted-1H-pyrazolo[5,1-c]-1,2,4-triazoles using acylated compounds and hypophosphorous acid.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a method and apparatus for forming fiber mixtures from multiple fiber types by sequentially removing partial quantities from individual fiber bales.
• The method involves measuring the entire momentary quantity of each fiber lot before each pass and determining a partial quantity corresponding to a predetermined proportion.
• Only the determined partial quantity is removed from the measured fiber lot during each pass.
• The method ensures that all fiber bales are opened without residual fibers and allows for an optimally homogeneous mixture.
• The partial quantity is calculated anew for each fiber bale in each pass, allowing for correction of any deviations.
• The method removes the partial quantity from each fiber lot not later than by the end of a predetermined period to maintain a determined time schedule.
• The apparatus includes a bale opener, a quantity measuring device, and a control device that determines the precise partial quantities to be removed and controls the fiber removing operation.
• The control device may include a timing relay to ensure that the partial quantity from each fiber lot is removed within the predetermined period.
</summary>

• The present invention relates to a method and apparatus for forming bias laid, non-woven fabrics with parallel courses of yarns, using a rake mechanism synchronized with, but driven separately from, the conveyors, yarn carrying means, and bonding mechanism.
• The rake mechanism accepts and retains yarns being carried by the yarn carrying means at the ends of their travel, allowing for parallel placement onto or between the needles on the conveyors, and aids in achieving complete parallelism within each layer and greater density and uniformity in the fabric.

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a method and apparatus for inserting different weft threads in a multiple-color air jet loom with appropriate weft carrying forces.
• In prior looms, air under uniform pressure is ejected from groups of main nozzles and subnozzles, resulting in constant weft carrying forces and varying weft thread speeds.
• The present invention ejects air under different pressures or for different intervals of time from main nozzle units or subnozzles to produce varying weft carrying forces for different weft threads.
• The different weft carrying forces can be produced by spacing subnozzles differently, supplying air under different pressures, ejecting air streams at different angles, or varying the intervals of time in which air is ejected.
• The on-off valves are selectively actuated by mechanical or electrical means in synchronism with the loom operation to control the air supply to the subnozzles for inserting the selected weft thread with the appropriate weft carrying force.
</summary>

* The present invention relates to a process for spinning bast fibres and making bast fibre yarn, which includes health preserving the fibres, opening, cleaning, and carding, and spinning the health preserved fibre strips. The health preservation step is implemented under specific temperature, humidity, and duration conditions to improve the flexibility and spinnability of bast fibres, reducing end breakage rate and improving work efficiency and product quality.
* The invention also covers a process for blended spinning bast fibres and other fibres, which follows the same steps as the bast fibre process but includes blending the health preserved bast fibres with other fibres before spinning. The blended fibres can be jute, kenaf, hemp, or a combination of these, and the weight percentage of bast fibres in the blend can range from 20% to 99%.
* The invention results in significant improvements over existing technologies, with end breakage rates averagely reduced to 150-200 times per hour for each machine when the yarn is 12 s in fineness. Examples of successful experiments using jute, kenaf, hemp, and linen fibres, as well as combinations of bast and other fibres, are provided.

* The present invention provides methods and apparatus for measuring and removing rotational variability from the nip pressure profile of nip presses using imbedded sensors in covered rolls.
* The invention allows for the calculation of a more accurate nip pressure profile by canceling out the effects of rotational variability, resulting in improved sheet characteristics and reduced downtime.

* The invention is an apparatus for an ironing board that supports an electrical cord and holds an article, such as a spray starch can or beverage container.
* The apparatus includes a "C" shaped clamp with a flexible cord support and a detachable article holder. The clamp has a retainer for the cord support and a second brace for the article holder.
* The cord support is a flexible mast with a foot that pivotably and slideably connects to the clamp, and the article holder has a lower circular hoop and a pair of support bars that form a base for retaining an article.
* The apparatus can be disassembled for storage by removing the cord support from the clamp and the article holder from the second brace, and the second rod of the cord support can be retracted against the ironing board.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a buttonhole controlling device for a sewing machine that can effectively form buttonholes in various materials without slippage or overlap.
• The device includes a foot pad, a travelling assembly with a slidable member, and an adjustable stop.
• The travelling assembly moves with the work during sewing and includes a tab to actuate the tripping lever on the machine, limiting the length of the buttonhole.
• The adjustable stop engages the tripping lever to terminate buttonhole formation, allowing the operator to precisely define the closure point.
• The operator positions the button between "V" notches on the device to establish the buttonhole length and adjusts a screw to engage the tripping lever and sew the buttonhole.
• The screw is adjusted as needed to ensure proper buttonhole formation in different materials, and the device can be used to sew buttonholes in various garments.
</summary>

* The text describes an apparatus for treating a dyed or printed textile web with a liquid, which includes a conveyor, a liquid applicator, a suction device, and a dwell stretch.
* The conveyor is an endless sieve belt for transporting the textile web along a predetermined horizontal path. The liquid applicator is at a first station along the path for applying the liquid to the web during motion. The suction device is at a second station for removing the liquid by suction during motion. The dwell stretch is between the applicator and the suction device for conducting the textile web in a spread-out condition and in a single layer through at least one dwell loop.
* The dwell stretch enables the textile web to be treated without stacking or running through a vat, resulting in effective washing without soiling a white background and maintaining tension at a small level.
* The apparatus can have a compact construction, and the suction device is disposed near the point of return of the web to the sieve belt to cause the web to adhere and be entrained by the belt, reducing longitudinal tensile stresses.

• The dry cleaning machine includes an air flow system for bringing ambient air into the access opening whenever the door is opened, which is separate from the air recirculating system and minimizes the exhausting of residual solvent vapors from the tubs.
• The air flow system consists of a separate intake fan and duct with a valve that is normally closed during normal operation, but opens when the door is opened to draw air into the access opening and directly into the interposed duct, minimizing the loss of solvent vapors.

* The present invention introduces a new method and apparatus for forming fine continuous filaments, particularly melt spun nonwoven webs, using an initial quench chamber and a continuous two-dimensional slot across the entire machine width.
* This design allows for good control of cross-machine uniformity, simpler process equipment, and improved web formation control compared to conventional eductive and non-eductive systems.
* The system uses the same air for quenching and drawing the filaments, resulting in higher pressures and velocities, less system hygiene issues, and easier cleaning compared to prior art systems.

• The first embodiment describes a sewing machine that uses ultrasonic waves to detect the position of a marker on a work cloth and set the sewing position accordingly.
• The second embodiment describes an embroidery unit with receivers for detecting ultrasonic waves, which can be attached to and detached from the bed of the sewing machine, allowing the work cloth to be held and moved by the embroidery unit.
• The third embodiment describes a sewing machine that uses an ultrasonic pen with an electromagnetic wave output circuit instead of a cable to transmit the position information to the sewing machine.
• The fourth embodiment describes a sewing machine with an additional receiver and an ultrasonic pen without an electromagnetic wave output circuit, allowing the machine to detect ultrasonic waves using multiple receivers and calculate the specified coordinates based on the detection timings.

* The present invention relates to methods and preparations for enhancing the utility of cellulosic fabric materials, specifically cotton, linen, or other natural fibers, by applying functional additives.
* One aspect of the invention uses ultrafine wool particles or powder as carriers for functional additives, which have demonstrated exceptional carrying and retention ability, improving the durability of functional enhancements.
* Another aspect of the invention uses ultrafine bamboo powder as a functional additive, which has good moisture management properties.
* The preparations are made by pulverizing the wool or bamboo into ultrafine powder and forming a suspension with water and a binding agent. Functional additives, such as ultraviolet protection or anti-bacterial agents, are then added to the suspension and mixed well. The preparation is applied to the cellulosic fabric material by printing, padding, or foam application, and the fabric is dried and cured before removing unfixed paste and chemicals by detergent washing. The treated fabric exhibits improved ultraviolet protection, moisture management, and wrinkle recovery properties compared to untreated fabric.

• The present invention relates to an automatic quilting machine with separate computers or process controllers to control the sewing machine functions and the quilting table movement independently, allowing for easier reprogramming of each function without requiring reprogramming of the entire system.
• The invention includes a frame quilting machine with a large metal frame, a sewing machine head, and a reprogrammable function for tracing and duplicating patterns using a computer aided design program. The sewing machine function is controlled by one computer, and the quilting table motion is controlled by a separate computer.

* The present invention relates to a method of manufacturing a two-sided nonwoven fabric with a three-dimensional image.
* The fabric is made by sandwiching a fluid-permeable support layer or scrim between two precursor webs, which are then hydroentangled on a three-dimensional image transfer device.
* The first and second precursor webs can be made of dissimilar fibrous matrices, which are separated by the intermediate support layer.
* The fabric can have apertures that extend partially or entirely through one or more layers.
* The fibrous constituents of the first and second precursor webs have a by fiber modulus difference of at least 10%.
* The precursor webs are pre-entangled on a foraminous surface before hydroentangling on the image transfer device.
* The fabric can be treated with various post-entanglement treatments, such as application of a polymeric binder composition, mechanical compacting, or application of surfactant or electrostatic compositions.
* The fabric can be used in various applications, including home, medical, and hygiene products, protective wear, and covers for vehicles and equipment.
* The present invention provides a durable three-dimensional image on the fabric while maintaining the desired softness and drapability.

* The invention is a device for feeding and sewing a strip of material onto a cut of fabric using a sewing machine. It includes a control setup with a stop that is carried by a lever and can be moved into the feed path of the strip to control the operation of the sewing machine.
* The stop is displaceable out of the feed path and can be connected to the sewing machine for controlling the sewing process based on the position of the stop and the strip material.
* The device includes a guide apparatus for the strip, a control means with a stop and lever, and a sewing machine control for feeding strip materials to a workpiece. It is simple in design, rugged in construction, and economical to manufacture.

<summary>

- The invention relates to a connective knitting method for joining two tape-shaped knit pieces using a flat knitting machine.
- The method involves knitting two tape-shaped knit pieces on a flat knitting machine with needle beds on both front and rear sides, one or both of which can move in the lateral direction.
- The two pieces are knitted with a boundary between them on one of the needle beds.
- When the pieces reach a specified length, the rear needle bed is moved to transfer the loop portion of the moving side knit fabric to the fixed side knit fabric.
- The loops are then overlaid and bound off, decreasing the number of loops in the moving side knit fabric.
- This process is repeated to join the end parts of both knit fabrics and prevent the final end portion from loosening.
- The knitting diagrams (Figs. 1A-1D) illustrate the principal courses until joining the end parts, while Figs. 1E and 1F show the courses for arranging the joined ends.
- The end-to-end joined state of the moving side knit fabric and fixed side knit fabric is shown in Figs. 2-5.
- The method can be used in various parts, such as the collar part of a sweater, neck rope portion of a tanktop, lower end portion of baseball stockings, and neck rope portion of an apron.
- The two pieces of knit fabric are knitted together and the transfers are carried out by a controlled computer following a designed knitting pattern.
</summary>

<summary>
• The text describes a production line for manufacturing flexible traction elements, such as lift bands, using stranded cables sheathed in a thermoplastic material.
• The stranded cables consist of a core strand and peripheral strand cords, which are made of materials with high tensile strength and are coated with a thermoplastic material before being embedded in the jacket.
• The production line includes a reel for unwinding the stranded cables, a device for precise orientation, a heater for preheating, an extruder for co-extrusion, a cooling trough, a roller store, a cutting device, and a storage roller.
• The stranded cables are positioned precisely in the jacket to ensure parallel surfaces have the same spacing from the embedded cables, which improves the overall quality of the traction element.
• The method for producing the traction element involves degreasing and preheating the stranded cables before embedding them in the thermoplastic material, which enhances the adhesion between the stranded cables and the jacket, resulting in improved long-term performance and reduced noise and vibration during lift operation.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a new rotary hook arrangement for a lockstitch sewing machine.
• The holding means which prevent rotation of the bobbin housing are arranged to hinder the guiding of the needle thread loop and pull-back as little as possible.
• The rotary hook has a hook body with a bobbin housing attached, which has a triangular shoulder with front and rear side faces.
• A spring rod extends between front and rear cams on a carrier attached to the base plate, hindering co-rotation of the bobbin housing.
• A capsule release device includes a finger that rotates the bobbin housing counter to the hook rotation, creating a gap for the needle thread loop to pass through unhindered.
• The design is simple, rugged, and economical to manufacture.
</summary>

The invention is about a new rotary hook arrangement for a lockstitch sewing machine. The holding means for preventing bobbin housing rotation are arranged to minimize interference with the needle thread loop's guiding and pull-back. The rotary hook has a hook body with a bobbin housing attached, which has a triangular shoulder with front and rear side faces. A spring rod extends between front and rear cams on a carrier attached to the base plate, hindering co-rotation of the bobbin housing. A capsule release device includes a finger that rotates the bobbin housing counter to the hook rotation, creating a gap for the needle thread loop to pass through unhindered. The design is simple, rugged, and economical to manufacture.

<summary>
• The text describes a method for producing silicon-based nanowires using electrospinning and four-component or five-component liquid silane inks.
• The four-component ink consists of a liquid silane, a polymer, an accelerant, and a solvent.
• The five-component ink adds a solid phase to the four-component ink.
• The liquid silane is a cyclosilane, such as cyclohexasilane or cyclopentasilane.
• The polymer is typically poly(methyl methacrylate) or a polycarbonate.
• The accelerant is a polyhydropolysilane or a derivative of cyclopentasilane.
• The solvent is typically toluene, xylene, cyclooctane, 1,2,4-trichlorobenzene, or dichloromethane.
• The solid phase can be metallic particles, semiconducting particles, or polydihydrosilane.
• The electrospun fibers are transformed into silicon wires through thermal or laser processing and can be coated with a conductive material for use in composite materials.
</summary>

<summary>

- The present invention is about a tension control arrangement for a spool creel with multiple spool holders.
- Each spool holder has a tensioning lever, a brake rotor (drum or disc), and an adjustable, tension responsive braking element.
- The tensioning lever has a roller that engages and is biased by the threads, and a biasing arrangement (piston/cylinder assembly) that is activated by fluid pressure.
- The tensioning lever occupies an angular position dependent upon thread tension and weight.
- The biasing arrangement operates in addition to the weight force on the tensioning lever, altering the thread tension.
- The fluid pressure is controllable in common for all the biasing arrangements, allowing for central thread tension determination for the entire creel.
- When the warping machine is shut off, the braking force throughout the entire creel can be increased for quick braking.
- The biasing arrangement uses a piston/cylinder assembly that can follow the swinging movement of the tensioning lever and prevent thread contamination.
- The tensioning lever subtends an angle of more than 45° to the horizontal plane, and the working elevation angle of the biasing arrangement attached to the tensioning lever is less than 45°.
- The biasing arrangement can also operate on a brake shoe that is applied to a further rotating braking surface under higher fluid pressures for rapid braking at shut down.

</summary>

Additionally, the tensioning lever can be hinged to the tensioning lever via a pin, and the braking shoe can be held by the tensioning lever to ensure simple construction and prevent locking on restart of the warping machine. The brake rotor can be a brake drum with a braking band or a braking disc of electro-conductive material with a magnetic system. The magnetic system can be a permanent magnet adjacent one of a pair of legs straddling the braking disc.

<summary>
• The present invention is a sewing machine detector that detects sewing machine speed, needle UP position, needle DOWN position, and thread trimmer timing position.
• The detector includes flat, sheet-shaped first, second, and third light shielding discs mounted on a shaft connected to the sewing machine shaft.
• The first and second light shielding discs have different colors and detect needle UP position and needle DOWN position, respectively. The third light shielding disc detects thread trimmer timing position.
• The optical fiber supporter includes two identical pieces with linear optical fiber fixing holes for locking the ends of the light sending and receiving optical fibers.
• The first and second reflecting portions are provided opposite the end faces of the light sending and receiving optical fibers, respectively.
• Light is transmitted from the light sending optical fibers, reflected by the first reflecting portions, and then transmitted through the light shielding discs and reflected by the second reflecting portions to enter the light receiving optical fibers.
• When the light shielding areas are in shielding positions, the absence of light is converted to an electrical signal.
• The power indicating optical fiber runs from the module section all the way to the detecting section, eliminating interference issues.
• The first to third light shielding discs are coaxially disposed, with the first disc unrotatably secured to the shaft and the second and third discs rotatably mounted.
• The present invention is less expensive to manufacture and results in a thinner, more compact detecting section than the conventional apparatus, and reduces stress imposed on the optical fibers.
</summary>

<summary>

- The present invention relates to a process for the continuous production of viscose rayon yarns with a high degree of whiteness.
- The process includes the completion of coagulation, washing with non-alkaline water, drying, and possibly finishing.
- The completion of coagulation can be achieved by passing time, an acid treatment, or a combination of both.
- The washing step reduces the amounts of certain elements, such as total sulphur, sulphur bound as sulphides, elemental sulphur, iron, zinc, and lead, to specific levels.
- The water used for washing should have a pH between 4.0 and 5.5 and be free from cations in excess amounts.
- The process produces a finished yarn with a high degree of white, and other treatments for improving the degree of white are not necessary, although they can be added.
</summary>

The process for the continuous production of viscose rayon yarns with a high degree of whiteness includes the following critical operations:

1. Completion of coagulation: This step is carried out on a partially coagulated and drawn yarn that has already left the coagulating bath and begun its helical travel. It can be achieved by passing time, an acid treatment, or a combination of both. The coagulation index, or "gamma index," should be between 15 and 25 at the exit from the coagulating bath and not higher than 1 at the final stage.
2. Washing with non-alkaline water: After the completion of coagulation, the yarn is treated with water having a non-alkaline pH. This treatment reduces the amounts of total sulphur, sulphur bound as sulphides, elemental sulphur, iron, zinc, and lead to specific levels. The washing is preferably carried out at temperatures between 20° and 30° C. and for a period of 25 to 40 seconds.
3. Drying: The yarn is then dried and possibly finished to obtain a degree of white not lower than 45.
4. Other treatments: Other treatments, such as treatments with baths having different acidities, can be carried out as long as the coagulation index is attained.

<summary>
• The text describes a system for deaerating pulp after oxygen treatment before washing.
• The deaeration tank is a small, closed cylindrical tank with an open top and flat bottom.
• The tank has an exterior diameter the same size as the oxygen reactor and a height of approximately 2D.
• The inlet pipe allows pulp to enter above the surface of the slurry and splash against the side wall.
• The outlet is located in the bottom plate and is sized to handle the amount of pulp leaving the tank, with recycled filtrate added.
• The height of slurry in the tank is controlled by a height sensor at the bottom, which operates a valve between the deaeration tank and the washer.
• The body of slurry is swirled by filtrate from the washer, entering the tank through a filtrate swirler inlet.
• The filtrate swirler inlet is located from the bottom of the tank a distance equal to 10-25% of the height of the tank and has a diameter of 0.095D.
• The emergency bypass line also has its center line between the bottom of the tank and the upper surface of the slurry and is in vertical alignment with the inlet pipe, with a diameter of 0.14D.
</summary>

* The text describes a new composite material concept called BTR (biomimetic tendon-reinforced) composite, which uses a function-oriented material design (FOMD) process to optimize the out-plane stiffness of the composite.
* The BTR composite structure includes tendons/muscles, ribs/bones, joints, flesh, skins, and shell. The tendons are evenly distributed in the matrix material and can be treated differently in tension and compression.
* The BTR composite can be extended to a three-dimensional lattice structure and can be used to develop composite armor. The carbon-rope reinforcement plan is optimized to withstand impact.
* The text also discusses various embodiments of the BTR composite, including the use of curved panels, hollow stuffer members, and bent-wire tendons. The use of hollow stuffer members and bent-wire tendons simplifies manufacture and can be automated using pick-and-place robotics.

• The present invention relates to a load-limiting device for braced frames that can plastically deform during a dynamic event to dissipate energy and preserve the structure from extensive damage.
• The load-limiting device may be easily removed and replaced after plastic deformation with another non-plastically deformed device.
• The device may be attached to a brace in a braced frame structure and may provide biaxial support while being able to dissipate energy.
• The load-limiting device may have elasto-plastic properties and may be constructed of a plastic or metal-based material.

• The present invention is a bedroom cabinet designed for use as a flophouse, with a flat exterior and increased mechanical strength.
• It consists of an outer casing and an inner casing, with a clearance formed between them for accommodating boxes or shelves without projecting within the cabinet or from its exterior.
• The bedroom cabinet has a venting system for natural ventilation and improved sound-proofing, achieved by forming a uniform air flow passage in the outer periphery of the inner casing.
• The bedroom cabinet can be stacked or installed adjacent to each other due to its flat exterior surfaces.
• The second embodiment of the invention includes spacer members interposed between the outer casing and the inner casing, forming a clearance over the entire periphery and acting as an intake and exhaust passage, as well as a sound-proofing wall.

* The present invention relates to a portable and simple guard rail system for use in construction sites to prevent accidental falls and meet safety guidelines.
* The system includes a guard rail support with a flat bottomed base plate, an upright column, guard rail support brackets, a kick board retaining flange, an angular brace, and a safety tie-off ring. The guard rail supports can be used with concrete-filled steel bases for anchoring to floors or ground surfaces. The system allows for efficient assembly and disassembly, reducing labor and material costs.

<summary>

- The present invention pertains to a method and apparatus for enhancing crude oil production from oil-bearing soils and rock formations using pulsed power electrohydraulic and electromagnetic discharges.
- The invention aims to increase the estimated ultimate recovery from reservoirs by causing oil flow to be enhanced.
- Approximately 66% of discovered oil is left in the ground due to the lack of effective extraction technology for secondary and tertiary Enhanced Oil Recovery (EOR).
- The invention provides a method for overcoming the limitations of current EOR methods, which rely on the injection of fluids and suffer from a lack of efficiency once the injected fluid attains a continuous phase between the injection and production wells.
- The invention uses pulsed power electrohydraulic and electromagnetic discharges to generate acoustic and coupled electromagnetic-acoustic vibrations that can cause oil flow to be enhanced.
- The invention builds on the teachings of U.S. Pat. No. 4,345,650, which discloses a method for generating strong acoustic vibrations for reservoir stimulation using electrohydraulic methods.
- The invention extends the effective range of the stimulation method by using a multi-level discharge device that allows sequential firing of several sources in one well in a time sequence that optimizes continuous electromagnetic-coupled stimulation of a large reservoir volume while the electrohydraulic acoustic pulse travels further from the pulse well.
- The invention also includes the use of EM pulse sources that do not generate a direct acoustic shock pulse, allowing the tool to be placed in more sensitive wells and extending the effective frequency range of induced vibrations that can be applied to a given reservoir.
- The invention can be used to recover hydrocarbons and separate them into their components, including associated gas, condensate, liquid hydrocarbons, helium and other noble gases, carbon dioxide, sulphur dioxide, pyrite, paraffins, heavy metals such as chromium, manganese and vanadium.
</summary>

<summary>
• The text describes a splice system for extending the length of a soil reinforcing element in Mechanically Stabilized Earth (MSE) structures.
• The splice includes wave plates with transverse protrusions to seat transverse wires from the soil reinforcing element and a grid-strip.
• The wave plates have perforations for receiving connective devices to secure the plates together.
• The transverse wires of the soil reinforcing element and grid-strip are interposed between the plates and prevented from removal.
• The splice can be used to create a composite soil reinforcing element by coupling multiple grid-strips to the soil reinforcing element.
• The splice can be secured using various connective devices and attachment methods.
</summary>

* The present invention relates to a plow blade with a fluid passageway and points of fluid ejection, produced using basic manufacturing processes for efficient production.
* The blade design includes a multiple component assembly for easy rebuilding and a process for ejecting specific fluids at controlled locations along the blade to maximize desirable characteristics while minimizing volume.

* The present invention is a building system that allows for larger stucco panels without movement joints, exceeding the current height limit of 2.4 meters and width limit of 4 meters.
* The system includes a frame or substructure, battens, inner and outer meshes, and a plaster matrix that penetrates both meshes and attaches to the outer mesh.
* The wall has at least one opening, and the periphery of each opening is reinforced with mesh and/or lattice-work at corners, vertical sides, and between adjacent openings.
* Preferred materials include battens of nominal 35 mm×40 mm cross-section, a non-metallic second mesh, and regional reinforcement by or including metallic or non-metallic mesh.
* The system aims to provide compliance with the plaster code NZS4251 and building code NZS3604, and to provide stucco walled structures with panel rigidity and integrity.
* The invention also includes methods to meet allowable regulations, such as the use of extra mesh reinforcement and movement control joints.
* The system includes various components, such as battens, studs, dwangs, staples, flashing tape, and sealant, which meet specific requirements.
* The document also includes figures and diagrams to illustrate various aspects of the invention.

* The invention describes a new and improved safe and door structure with a rectangular valuables receiving chamber and a separate steel door with inwardly extending ledges and grooves for retaining the door.
* The door is laterally displaced until it is seated in the grooves, with a lock assembly on the reverse side engaging a detent in one bar for prevention of lateral movement and reinforcing bolts on both sides preventing transmission of force to the lock mechanism in case of intrusion attempts.
* The safe can be formed using an in-place concrete construction or all metal fabrication methods.
* The invention provides an efficient and simple locking arrangement with a notch and safety bolts to protect the lockset from damage during prying attempts.

* The text describes various embodiments of geological formation pressure sensing systems that accurately measure formation pressures at desired depths by isolating the pressure sensing apparatus to pressures produced by the formation at such depth.
* The systems involve cementing a conduit with a filter at its bottom end in the borehole at a desired location, pressurizing the conduit to clear it of cement grout, and creating a fluid connection between the formation and the filter to measure pressures directly from the formation.

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a jointing structure in vehicle traveling path joints and the like having an expansion function, which prevents tire fall-in and/or stuck-in situations, ensures high slip resistance to tires, and is easy to maintain.
• The structure includes more than one step provided face to face at the coaxially built traveling path ends with an expansion gap between, more than one elastic member respectively mounted inside the steps, and a joint block mounted on the elastic members across the expansion gap.
• The joint block blocks up the expansion gap while permitting expansion gap function, allowing for smooth and safe vehicle traveling. The elastic members are made of laminated rubber and are easily joined together and subjected to deformation.
• The use of a joint block made of the same concrete as the traveling path and high-strength fiber-reinforced concrete provides increased slip resistance and durability.
• The elastic members are designed to permit no deformation at the time when the bridge girder length in time of ordinary temperatures has been reached, eliminating the need for expansion gap adjustments and troublesome mounting.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a floor track system for transporting wheeled trucks into and out of a fluid treatment chamber without contaminating the sanitary environment.
• The invention includes an enclosed floor track system with a wheel channel and a cover plate to prevent showered fluid or floor liquid from entering the channel and becoming contaminated by the truck wheels.
• The cover plate can be pivoted away from the wheel channel for cleaning.
• Another embodiment of the invention utilizes inflatable elastomer seals to enclose the interior wheel channel of the track and prevent entry of brine solution into the guide track.
• The enclosed floor track system is well adapted for use in a meat product chilling chamber, but the principles of the invention may find applications in other industries.
• The floor tracks extend to the entrance of the fluid treatment chamber and are pitched to drain away liquid.
• The enclosed floor tracks prevent brine solution from entering the track system and becoming contaminated by the hand truck wheels.
• The enclosed floor tracks are supported above the chamber floor by support legs and are angled to drain any liquid within the tracks into a waste sewer.
• The enclosed floor tracks are well adapted for use with hand trucks having horizontally axled wheel structures or depending I-beam struts.
• The invention enhances the recovery and reuse of the brine solution by segregating the hand truck wheel structure from the general environment within the fluid treatment chamber.
</summary>

* The present invention relates to a lock device for preventing a work machine's boom of a construction machine from being tilted by its own weight.
* The lock device includes an engaging member and an engaged member, with the engaging member having a hook part and a slot, and a support pin inserted into the slot with a guide member above it. The engaging member also has first and second surfaces, with the first surface parallel to the slot and the second surface slanted from it.
* When the engaged member is released from the hook part, either the first or second surface can touch the guide member. When the engaged member is engaged with the hook part, the second surface touches the guide member.
* The guide member is provided on the boom and does not become horizontal while the boom is rotated between its highest and lowest positions. The engaging member's end surface is enabled to touch the engaged member and is slanted toward the lengthwise center of the engaging member. A slip-prevention plate is fixed to the tip of the support pin and the support pin can be inserted into the slot through the slip-prevention plate at a prescribed angle. A member supporting the engaging member is projected from the boom bracket and the guide member is formed integrally with the boom bracket. The engaging member is provided with upper and lower guide members that slidably touch the other side of the engaging member. The lock device allows for easy locking and unlocking of the boom, maintains the lock position at any rotation position, prevents engaging member and engaged member damage, and reduces parts and assembly processes.

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a swimming pool vacuum cleaner with an adjustable suction head.
• The adjustment mechanisms are located on the top of the vacuum head and can be quickly operated by hand.
• The suction exerted by the vacuum head can be precisely regulated without adjusting the remotely located suction source.
• The invention includes an adjustment mechanism that can be added to certain types of existing pool cleaning devices without major retrofit.
• The adjustment mechanism is simple, easy to use, and can be manufactured inexpensively.
</summary>

The text describes an invention for a swimming pool vacuum cleaner with an adjustable suction head. The adjustment mechanisms are located on the top of the vacuum head and can be quickly and easily operated by hand. This allows for precise regulation of the suction exerted by the vacuum head without the need to adjust the remotely located suction source. The invention includes an adjustment mechanism that can be added to certain types of existing pool cleaning devices without major retrofit. The mechanism is simple, easy to use, and can be manufactured inexpensively. The text also mentions that the adjustment is accomplished using conveniently located adjustment mechanisms provided on the top of the suction head, which precisely regulate the spacing between the lower surface of the central, suction portion of the suction head and the bottom of the pool. The text also mentions that the adjustment mechanisms can be added to existing devices with relatively minor changes, and that the adjustment device can be sold in kit form. The text also describes the construction of the suction head assembly, including the platform, handle assembly, outboard and inboard roller assemblies, and frame member. The text also mentions that the adjustment mechanism functions by allowing the wheels to be lowered, which causes an upward deformation of the platform and increases the spacing between the central, suction portion of the platform and the pool bottom. The text also mentions that a coil spring is used to yieldably resist downward movement of the frame, and that the roller height adjustment device can be provided in kit form for use with certain types of prior art suction head assemblies. The text also describes the assembly process for attaching the adjustment device to an existing unit.

<summary>

- The present invention relates to an apparatus for retrieving a wear bushing from inside a well head and casing.
- Wear bushings protect against excessive wear on seal areas of casing heads and other well head elements.
- In some cases, it's necessary to retrieve the wear bushing without the use of the drill bit.
- Existing methods for retrieving a wear bushing include using a J-slot and a retriever body with dowels or a tool with a longitudinal bore and a threadably removable lower collar.
- The present invention provides a sub-unit with a mandrel, a threadably removable lower collar, and a retriever section.
- The retriever section is circular in shape, slidably movable between the end collars, and has protruding members for engaging an extended J-slot of a wear bushing.
- The sub-unit also has grooves along the mandrel for accommodating insertion members on the retriever unit, preventing rotational movement while allowing vertical movement.
- The apparatus is removably securable on the exterior surface of a sub-unit, allowing for quick removal and installation during drilling operations.
- The apparatus can be threadably engaged between any two sections of drill pipe without retrieving the drill bit from the hole.
- An additional embodiment of the retriever unit includes a threaded lower end section for retrieving a wear bushing with a threaded collar.
</summary>

<summary>

- The invention relates to a vibratory tool for downhole use with a central passage for wireline or other tool access.
- The tool has a mandrel connected to the surface through a string and a passage in fluid communication with the string.
- Pressure in the passage pushes down the piston attached to the mandrel, displacing fluid and imparting force.
- The tool has a drop-in plug to close off the passage and initiate vibrations.
- The dump valve is cylindrically shaped with a seal ring that moves between surfaces to open and close the valve without slamming against a seat.
- Stacking pistons in the tool body increases the area of total pistons exposed to the applied pressure, increasing the tool's power.
- The tool can be operated with or without jarring blows depending on the surface overpull applied to the string.
- The tool can be made with fewer moving parts than previous designs, making it simpler and cheaper.
- The valve and spring are designed to better perform in a cyclical loading environment.
- The tool can be used for various applications, including stimulation or fishing operations, and can have a rotational lock for torque transmission.
</summary>

<summary>

- The present invention is a retaining wall system that uses precast concrete face panels with integral counterforts and a separate precast base.
- The counterforts extend perpendicularly from the face panel and have openings for drainage and rebars for reinforcement.
- The base is a solid, rectangular or trapezoidal platform that can be set on grade and has openings for the downward-extending rebar ends from the counterforts.
- The connection between the face panel and base is made by inserting the rebar ends into the openings and filling the connection with grout.
- The system allows for flexibility in height and width, and can be used in various soil conditions and with different types of reinforcement and connection methods.
</summary>

Additionally, the text mentions the following options:

- The base can have a shear key or lip to help secure the connection to the ground.
- The base can be set on H-piles for added stability.
- A vehicle impact barrier can be formed on top of or behind the wall.
- The system can be used in combination with other retaining walls by using a shear key or ship laps between adjacent modules.
- The base can be textured or roughened, or have grout injected into the voids beneath it to increase friction and prevent sliding.

<summary>

- The present invention relates to a down hole heating system for improving oil and gas well production by effectively focusing heat on the production zone and protecting electrical components from down hole fluids.
- The system includes a heating unit with electrical resistance type heater rods, insulating packer, and stainless steel collars to contain heat within the production zone.
- The electrical connections between the power leads and heater rods are shielded from down hole pressures and chemicals by encasing the terminal portion of the heater rods in a cement block and steel fitting assembly.
- The use of high-temperature cement, continuous welding, and suitable leads ensures reliable power delivery and long-term operation.
- The method for using the system involves heating the production zone to improve oil or gas flow, and it can also be applied using cable (wire line) instead of down hole pipe for supporting the heating unit during well treatments or maintenance.
- The invention is not limited to the described embodiments, and modifications and alternative designs may fall within the scope of the invention.
</summary>

The present invention is a down hole heating system for improving oil and gas well production by effectively focusing heat on the production zone and protecting electrical components from down hole fluids. The electrical connections between the power leads and heater rods are shielded from down hole pressures and chemicals by encasing the terminal portion of the heater rods in a cement block and steel fitting assembly. The method for using the system involves heating the production zone to improve oil or gas flow, and it can also be applied using cable (wire line) instead of down hole pipe for supporting the heating unit during well treatments or maintenance. The invention is not limited to the described embodiments, and modifications and alternative designs may fall within the scope of the invention.

• The mechanism includes an outer tubular body with an inner body structure that moves telescopically to selectively engage with the object, and a catch mechanism for locking and unlocking the tool.

<summary>
• The text describes a method for manufacturing composed stave floors or engineering floors with improved physical, aesthetic, and functional properties.
• Conventional stave floors have a thin sight substrate (2-3 mm) and base substrate (12-19 mm), which can warp, curl, or detach during sanding or use.
• The present invention uses a sight substrate with a thickness of at least 4 mm and a base substrate with a thickness of at least 12 mm.
• The substrates are assembled with glue and multidirectional holding means, including dendrites, adhesion and horizontal reinforcement means, and adhesion and vertical reinforcement means.
• The dendrites are used to prevent displacement or changes in dimensions during assembly.
• The floor provides increased durability and allows for corrective maintenance.
• The sight substrate can be obtained from decorative or functional substrate, wood cut in tangential, quarter, or other forms.
• The example embodiment was tested and did not exhibit deformation or detachment.
• The use of multidirectional holding means and a thicker sight substrate improves the overall quality and longevity of the floor.
• The example embodiment is not limited to the specific dimensions or holding means mentioned, and any modifications within the skill of the art are considered within the scope of the invention.
</summary>

• The present invention is a ladder attachment that enhances lateral stability, prevents defacing of work surfaces, and allows ladders to straddle corners.
• It consists of large contact area braces with an extension arm and a flange on one end, and a U-bolt and nuts to secure the flange to the ladder rung.
• A resilient pad assembly is pivotally connected to the extension arm to provide a non-slip gripping portion.
• The design can accommodate different ladder sizes and can be used on various rungs.
• The arm and flange are made of strong, durable material, and the clamp secures the assembly to the ladder siderail.
• The arm can be twisted to allow the resilient pad to pivot horizontally for corner straddling.
</summary>

* The present invention relates to a fastener assembly for use in a fastener driving tool, which includes a row of fasteners arranged parallel to each other and a collation system formed from a plastic material that is molded onto and adhered to the fasteners.
* The plastic material defines a collar portion that captures or encircles the fastener shank and a connecting portion between adjacent fasteners. The plastic material is formulated from an adhesive polymer such as a polyolefin or a polyolefin blend, and the nails are preheated prior to molding to enhance adhesion.
* The connecting portion includes a bridge and a rib, which have a cruciform shape and the rib is tapered and narrows toward the tip of the fastener. The rib can also be embossed or have an embossed pattern in the connecting portion.
* The upper and lower collations are parallel to each other, with the lower collation being narrower than the upper collation. The lower collation is formed on the shank within the lower half and nearer to the tip of the fastener.
* The collation system reduces debris generation by encouraging separation of the connecting portion from the collar at a desired location, which reduces the impact on the connecting portion by the fastener as it is driven into the substrate.
* The fastener assembly can also be configured to influence or encourage separation of the fasteners from one another at a desired location, further reducing debris.

- The invention relates to a nozzle for applying sealants, particularly silicones, in various industries such as aviation, automotive, naval, railway, and robotics.
- The nozzle comprises a bell or hood shaped tip and an injection button.
- The nozzle has a main elongated hollow body with a truncated cone shape and a threaded exterior surface for connecting to cartridges or injection machines.
- The bell or hood shaped section is sized to encapsulate rivets or nuts and provides a connection element.
- The injection button has a circular main body with a hollow central circular protrusion and multiple series of radially oriented channels ending in orifices.
- The bell shaped section and injection button are cooperatively designed to allow a strong and firm non-permanent connection.
- The nozzle may be made of plastic, preferably polypropylene.
- The nozzle allows for precision sealing operations, preventing the plugging of orifices and ensuring a perfect seal from air and oxidising liquids.
- The nozzle can be used with both manual cartridges and automatic injection machines.
- The nozzle design reduces sealant application time, saving labor and increasing the quality of the resulting sealant application.
</summary>

• The text describes a position sensor system that uses a waveform generator and an error correction generator to modify the sensing signal and provide it to a remote monitor via two wires.
• The error correction generator determines and eliminates static and error signals that do not deliver information about the position of an object being sensed.
• A window reference circuit constantly compares the ideal sensor output to the existing sensor output and adjusts it if necessary.
• The sensor can be recalibrated at any time by removing and reapplying power, and upon power-up, it draws a minimum current.
• The sensor system uses a window comparator, a controller, and a signal processor to provide error correction signals.
• The sensor is most desirable for multiplexing with other sensors due to its ability to provide conditioned sensing signals via two wires to a remotely located sensor monitoring system.
</summary>

<summary>
• The text describes an invention related to a desmodromic valve actuation system for internal combustion engines.
• The standard method of controlling valves uses a timing belt and cams, but this system eliminates the need for springs.
• The system allows for infinitely variable valve displacement, enabling precise control of valve opening and closing.
• The system consists of a reciprocating cam translating device coupled to a rotary cam, which converts linear motion into variable reciprocating motion for the valve.
• The valve moves up and down based on the angle the slot makes with the line of action of the first translating means.
• The system allows for computer control of each valve, enabling operation of any set of pistons and variable valve displacement.
• The system is simpler and more effective than traditional cam-spring valve actuation systems, with fewer components and less mass inertia.
• The invention can be applied to engines with multiple valves per cylinder, with a single cam controlling multiple valves through a multi-fingered drive link.
</summary>

* The present invention relates to a cooled flow deflection apparatus for thermal machines, specifically for high-temperature fluid-flow machines, to reduce material temperatures and improve cooling efficiency.
* The invention aims to overcome disadvantages of prior art flow deflection apparatuses, such as complex casting, high blade weight, and difficulty cooling transitional regions.
* The invention achieves this by constructing separating walls as separate inserts that are subsequently inserted into the apparatus and secured, rather than casting them together.
* Advantages include simpler casting, reduced thermal stresses, weight reduction, and easier cooling system adjustment.
* A preferred embodiment involves a hollow casting with integrally formed holders for inserting and securing separating walls.
* Separating walls can be flat strips of metallic or heat-resistant non-metallic materials.
* Separating walls can be straight or bent into a U-shape to deflect cooling fluid between adjacent channels.
* The invention can be applied to various types of flow deflection apparatuses, including rotor blades in gas turbines.

* The present invention is a system for controlling the fuel delivery system of a vehicle, which can be switched between automatic and manual control.
* The system comprises a control unit that receives signals for accelerator pedal position and throttle valve position, and provides a control signal to a DC motor or stepper motor to set the throttle position. The control unit also provides an output signal to control a clutch, allowing the driver to manually control the throttle valve when desired.
* The system allows for smooth switching between automatic and manual control without causing the vehicle to lurch forward or stall, and can be used in conjunction with a continuously variable transmission.

<summary>
• The invention pertains to methods and apparatus for generating heat from waste fuels, specifically wood waste, with minimal particulate emissions.
• Conventional hog fuel burners have been inefficient and produce dirty exhaust gases, leading to frequent and expensive boiler cleaning.
• The invention aims to provide a clean burning waste fuel burner that can deliver exhaust gases as clean as those produced by oil and gas burners.
• The burner forms a conical pile of waste fuel with preheated underfire air percolating up through it, drying and gasifying the fuel.
• Swirl air is introduced tangentially in a primary combustion chamber to maintain a steady temperature and separate particulate from the gas stream.
• The volatile gases are discharged from the primary chamber into a secondary combustion chamber for complete combustion.
• Secondary combustion air is introduced tangentially to maintain good separation of particulate from the gas stream and regulate flame position.
• The flame holder in the secondary chamber prevents secondary chamber particulate material from entering and causes elusive particles to fall back into the primary chamber.
• A pressure isolator can be added to the primary chamber to minimize the tendency of secondary combustion air to enter the primary chamber.
• The burner can be adjusted to operate with a low volume or high volume of fuel, with quick response times and minimal clinker or slag formation.
</summary>

* The present invention is an efficient evaporative refrigeration system that keeps evaporating water separate from the cooling air stream through a heat exchanger, achieving sensible cooling.
* The system uses a major portion of the working air from the room to be cooled and a major portion of fresh air for the dry side of the heat exchanger, resulting in maximum cooling at the lowest energy cost. The heat exchanger is an array of spaced vertically directed hollow elongated tubular members with countercurrent flow of water and return air, and cooled air is distributed to different zones in the enclosure by variable speed blowers. The moisture-laden return air is exhausted or heat-exchanged with fresh air before being discharged exteriorly. Optional features include recirculation of return air and bypass of cooled air for increased cooling rate or lower useful air temperature. The system has a capacity of 30,000 BTU per hour and is more efficient and energy-efficient than a comparable vapor compression refrigeration unit. In a further embodiment, a composite hybrid system is provided in which a minor portion of the cooled air is further cooled by heat exchange with the evaporator of a vapor compression refrigeration unit, resulting in additional cooling and energy savings.

- The text describes a fluid pump with two or more pump heads arranged in series, where fluid flows from a reservoir into one pump head and then to the next pump head in the series, to be eventually discharged from an outlet in a final pump head.
- Each pump head comprises a housing within which an impeller is contained, the impeller being driven by a drive structure to move fluid. The housing of the pump head comprises an inlet through which fluid is drawn from outside the housing, and the fluid is moved by the impeller from the housing into at least two fluid conduits, preferably at least three fluid conduits, to be combined into one fluid flow before exiting the pump head.
- The drive structure comprises any one or collection of structures that is configured to impart rotational motion on the impellers. It is preferably powered by a single power source, such as a motor.
- The pump heads are connected to provide rigidity and a fluid seal between the pump heads. They may be removably connected or may be formed in a unitary structure.
- The pump may be mounted on a support structure, such as a wheeled boom, a hitching assembly, or a trailer, to permit operation at a fluid reservoir.
- The text also describes a biconical tubular connector used to connect two pump heads and frictionally secure one drive shaft in the connector, preventing fluid from entering the drive train and protecting it from corrosion and befouling.
- The text also describes a second combiner for combining fluid flow from the at least two fluid conduits into a single fluid flow, and a mounting plate and combiner extension for securing the combiner to the pump housing.
</summary>
