<summary>
• The present invention relates to engine compression release brakes for engines with less than all cylinders having engine brakes.
• Traditional engine compression release brake systems include an engine brake for each cylinder, but excess components can be removed to improve engine robustness.
• The invention includes an engine with a modular engine compression release brake system for a portion of the engine cylinders.
• The method of engine braking using less than all engine cylinders includes attaching an engine compression release brake to the engine housing for the portion of cylinders and operating them in a braking mode.
• Each engine compression release brake is operably coupled to a cam actuated exhaust valve.
• The engine includes a high pressure pump, a hydraulic system, and an electronic control module that controls multiple aspects of engine operation.
• Each cylinder has a movable piston, a hydraulically actuated fuel injector, a cam actuated exhaust valve, and a hydraulically actuated engine compression release brake.
• The engine compression release brake includes a brake body, an electrical actuator, and a spool valve member that is movable between an upward, retracted position and a downward, advanced position.
• The engine compression release brake operates by using high pressure fluid to move a piston and open the exhaust valve during the compression stroke of the piston.
</summary>

<summary>
• The text describes an invention related to support structures, specifically a mounting link between an engine and a gearbox.
• Aircraft gas turbine auxiliary gearboxes are subjected to various loads, including blade-off events, which can cause severe damage.
• The invention includes a link assembly with a male link, a female link, and a pin to selectively retain them.
• The female link receives the male link to allow translation and forms a radial interface for dampening translation.
• The radial interface provides coulomb damping to dissipate energy created by translation.
• The pin can serve as a fusible link and shear under extreme loads.
• The female link and male link translate axially after the pin shears, limiting damage to the gearbox and preventing detachment from the engine.
• The use of the pin and coulomb damping obviates the need for all linkages and peripheral connections to survive extreme loads.
• The pin can be replaced during maintenance following any shock sufficient to break it.
• The terminology used is not limiting, and many modifications and variations are possible within the scope of the claims.
</summary>

* The present invention introduces a point cap system with an adjustable weight balance pin for perfect arrow balance, reducing the material and weight of arrow points and improving the use of unidirectional fiber reinforced arrow shafts.
* The point cap system includes a small, lightweight point cap with external threads for arrow point attachment and a balance pin whose weight can be adjusted to balance the arrow shaft.
* The invention also provides means to attach points to arrow shafts without allowing dirt to enter, and a point adaptor with internal threads for various arrow points and a nock cap adaptor for attaching nocks to arrow shafts.

• The Small Arms Firing Effect Simulator (SAFES) is an electronic pyrotechnic device for simulating small arms fire noise and flash without modifying the weapon or using mechanical actuation.
• It utilizes a plastic expendable housing a metal/oxidizer pyrotechnic and an electrical ignition system.
• The expendable contains a plurality of rounds and is installed in a firing unit that can be inserted into the weapon via the magazine breech.
• The electrical control circuit provides for automatic and semiautomatic fire, interfaces with the weapon trigger and bolt, and produces sound and flash by the electrical ignition of the pyrotechnic in a confined space.
• The invention is designed to be reliable, low maintenance, reusable, and safe, as it does not require dangerous pressurization of the ignition chamber.
• The SAFES is packaged to resemble the magazine clip of the M16 rifle and is designed for use with a MILES unit attached to the weapon.

<summary>
• The present invention provides an air intake device for an internal combustion engine with a tank, two pipes interconnecting the tank and intake passage, and a control valve in the larger pipe, actuated by a vacuum diaphragm actuator.
• The smaller pipe is located upstream of the larger pipe and has a smaller cross-sectional area, creating a resonator that absorbs intake noise while improving engine performance.
• The control valve is actuated based on engine load conditions, allowing the engine to operate with improved volumetric efficiency and reduced intake noise.
• The smaller pipe is preferably located near the air cleaner and has a cross-sectional area smaller than one-tenth that of the larger pipe.
</summary>

• The invention is a two-part mounting bracket assembly consisting of a stationary bracket and an adjustable bracket, allowing for easy mounting of equipment on various surfaces with one person.
• The assembly includes tapered springs, hooks and tabs for easy connection, and can be used on poles with pole clamp assemblies, providing 360 degrees of horizontal adjustment and excellent resistance to rotation and slippage.

* The text describes a burner system for various heat utilizing appliances with interchangeable modules, including a burner with a combustion chamber, outer shroud, and air flow control for secondary and tertiary combustion.
* The burner includes a fuel holder, ash pan, and a grill or cover, and can be supported by one or more legs. It also has a hinged cover and grill, and can be detachably coupled to modular heat utilizing appliances using draw latches.
* The modular heat utilizing appliances include closed and open cookers, a space heater, and a pyrolyzer. The pyrolyzer has a sealed heating chamber, condenser, and vaporized product conduits for use as fuel or for external distribution.
* The burner system can be operated with solid fuel and can be designed for efficient combustion and minimal emissions. The modular design allows for the use of various heat utilizing appliances with a single burner.
* The text also mentions the possibility of a fuel feed feature for continuous operation and various modifications and combinations of components within the spirit and scope of the invention.

<summary>

- The text discusses the cooling system and spark plug arrangement in a rotary internal combustion engine.
- The in-line spark plug arrangement in prior art rotor housings creates cooling flow disruptions and vapor film build-up, preventing efficient heat transfer.
- The invention introduces staggered spark plug bosses, which are offset but symmetrically oppositely oriented about a centerplane, promoting close in-line arrangement of spark plug terminals.
- The use of a predetermined offset from a line extending between the spark plug terminals allows for staggered boss configuration without affecting combustion flame propagation.
- The incorporation of flow diverters or controllers between the spark plug bosses ensures a controlled flow regime and strengthens the housing structure.
- The staggered spark plug bosses improve coolant performance by reducing locally high thermal conditions and providing separate paths for vapor release during boiling heat transfer.
- The heat transfer coefficient between the flow and bosses is increased by up to 44% with staggered spark plug bosses compared to in-line arrangements.
- The invention is important for spacings between bosses up to 50 boss diameters when the boss diameter is relatively small, and up to 12 diameters when the boss diameter is large.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention is a method of minimizing steam boiler pressure changes or turbine power changes during turbine control valve operational safety testing by using control valve positions as feedback.
• The method maintains the total mass flow through several parallel turbine inlet flow control valves constant, which in turn maintains the steam generator pressure constant and keeps the inlet pressure regulator unaffected.
• The flow difference between the N and N-1 condition for each valve is determined during the turbine design process and used to compensate for the flow change caused by the closure of one valve during testing.
• The test compensation circuit uses a look-up table (Test Comp Array) to determine the required flow compensation for the three input control valves not under test based on the mass flow demanded by the TCV Reference.
• The use of the control valve test compensating control system reduces the pressure excursion of the turbine inlet main steam pressure by 95% compared to not using flow compensation.
</summary>

<summary>
• The text describes an invention of a mixing valve for an aircraft cleaning apparatus with two inlets A and B, and one outlet, allowing a solution ranging from 0% inlet A fluid, 100% inlet B fluid to 100% inlet A fluid, 0% inlet B fluid.
• The valve system includes a valve body, two inlet passages, an outlet passage, and a valve means for directing the two fluids toward the outlet passage.
• The valve means is adjustable to permit the mixture to range between 0% first fluid, 100% second fluid to 100% first fluid, 0% second fluid.
• The valve body defines a bore with a first inlet passage for receiving a first fluid at a first predetermined pressure, a second inlet passage for receiving a second fluid at a second predetermined pressure, and an outlet passage for providing a proportional mixture of the two fluids.
• The valve system includes a flow restricting device to reduce the flow rate of fluid from the first inlet passage to the valve body.
• The valve system maintains constant pressure cleaning solution to each user while allowing each user to have complete control over the strength of the particular cleaning solution being used.
• The valve system allows multiple identical valve systems to be operated from a common soap solution source and common water source without adversely affecting the fluid pressure required by each user.
</summary>

* The present invention proposes a method and arrangement for compressing gas in a compressor station for a gas pipeline in permanent frost areas, which includes compressing gas to an excess pressure, cooling it by heat exchange, and expanding it to the desired exit pressure to obtain further cooling.
* The compressor station includes a compressor, heat exchanger, valve-controlled pipelines, control units, an electronic control system, and an expanding unit. The electronic control system operates the compressor to compress gas to an excess pressure and the expanding unit expands the compressed gas to the desired exit pressure.
* The method utilizes the physical effect that a compressed gas is cooled when expanded to a lower pressure, either by throttling or with the simultaneous performance of work. The excess pressure is selected to ensure sufficient cooling during expansion to obtain the desired exit temperature.
* The invention provides advantages such as reduced investments, lower operation risk, and the ability to exchange compressors during different seasons to adapt to changing requirements and environmental conditions.

<summary>

- The text describes a cooling fan assembly system that eliminates the need for fasteners to secure the fan to a panel.
- The fan assembly includes a motor, fan blade, and mounting legs with resilient leg portions and spring members.
- The panel provides the mounting interface and includes recess portions with enlarged and residual openings.
- To install the fan assembly, a compressive and rotating force is applied to the assembly or panel, compressing the spring member and moving the fan assembly into the partially and fully installed positions.
- The fan assembly's resilient leg portions enter into the residual opening as it is fully installed, capturing each leg portion pair within its respective opening.
- The spring member urges the fan assembly against the panel, preventing vibrational noise and preventing vibrational forces from causing the legs to "back out" of their openings.
- The system is applicable to various applications where forced air cooling is necessary, including computers and automotive industries.
</summary>

* The text describes the use of kinematic mounts in spacecraft applications and the need for vibration reduction to protect instruments from high loads.
* The invention introduces damping mechanisms into kinematic mounts using vibration damping materials, preserving their fundamental features while reducing high energy disturbances to the instrument.
* Two damper designs are presented: a spherical damper using viscoelastic material and a cylindrical slot damper using o-rings. Both designs dissipate vibration energy in different ways.
* The text also discusses the benefits of using damped kinematic mounts, including improved performance, design simplification, and the ability to uncouple suspension modes for specific applications.

- The invention is a large size oil shear type clutch unit for use in an aircraft catapult system, which utilizes interleaved clutch plates and discs, separate means for closing the gap between each disc and its adjacent plates, and hydraulic fluid for both retracting the plates to reduce residual drag and as a coolant for the clutch discs.
- The clutch unit comprises a servo control valve, first and second stage amplifiers, and a clutch unit with separate piston and cylinder means for each set of clutch disc segments and clutch plates, which are actuated in parallel to apply full force and transmit maximum torque.
- The segmental disc arrangement minimizes the deleterious effects of heat on the discs and allows for convenient inspection without requiring complete disassembly of the unit.
- The present invention minimizes residual drag, which is crucial in high-power clutch units, by utilizing the centrifugal force of the oil to retract the discs instead of retraction springs, which might malfunction in large and fast units.
</summary>

<summary>
• The text describes a system for an internal combustion engine that uses expansion cylinders to expand exhaust gas and water, which is then used to drive a common crankshaft.
• The system aims to eliminate the need for a radiator by lowering the temperature of the exhaust gas and water to a sufficient extent.
• The text also suggests various features such as water injection, gearing between cylinders, and catalytic materials to improve the system's efficiency and reduce exhaust emissions.

• The present invention concerns a method for fabricating plates or blanks of coated steel intended for welding and heat treatment to obtain parts with good mechanical characteristics and corrosion resistance.
• The invention eliminates the need for special furnaces and surface operations on treated parts by using a coating that prevents decarburization and oxidation during heat treatment.
• The fabrication method involves removing a portion of the metal alloy layer from the coating on the periphery of the plate before welding to prevent the introduction of coating elements into the molten area and to ensure satisfactory corrosion resistance after heat treatment.
• The method can be applied to butt-welded blanks and can be integrated into existing welding lines with minimal modifications.
• The invention provides a plate with a steel substrate and a precoat consisting of an intermetallic alloy layer in contact with the substrate, topped by a metal alloy layer, with a portion of the metal alloy layer removed on at least one precoated face. The width of the area from which the metal alloy has been removed is preferably between 0.2 and 2.2 mm and can be produced by brushing or laser beam ablation. The intermetallic alloy layer is converted into an intermetallic alloy compound during heat treatment, providing protection against corrosion and decarburization of the steel substrate.

* The text describes an invention related to a rolling body guide cage and a method for manufacturing it.
* The cage consists of a ring element made from sheet metal, which is produced using forming techniques and has several rolling body guide structures arranged in the circumferential direction.
* The ring element is composed of at least two flat material ring segments, which are joined to one another in the circumferential direction and welded together before the formation of the axial profiling.
* The flat material ring segments are put together and welded along their edge regions in the engagement zones, which form undercut geometries and positively engage with one another.
* The 120° ring segments can be punched out from a sheet metal strip in close succession, allowing for a high material saving and the formation of circular arc-like inner and outer edges and joint geometries in one step.
* The invention is suitable for the manufacture of radial and axial bearing cages, including groove and angular ball bearings.
* The method for manufacturing the cage involves welding the flat material ring segments together before the forming step.
* The weld points can be formed using laser welding or pressure welding, and the ring segments can be slightly oversized and then cut and calibrated after welding.
* The punching and welding steps can be carried out in overlapping chronological order, and the ring segments can be joined together before or after punching to form a stack or ring segment block.
* The text includes several figures illustrating various aspects of the invention, including the structure of a ring segment, a cage part, an axial needle bearing cage, and an axial ball roller bearing cage.

* The text also discusses methods and systems for generating travel directions for a service technician between multiple customer service locations using a mapping system and GPS system.

- The text describes a system for compensating electromagnetic interfering fields using two real triaxial magnetic field sensors, three pairs of compensation coils, and one control unit.
- The control unit is designed as a control processor such as a Digital Signal Processor (DSP) or a field programmable gate array (FPGA).
- The output signals of the two real sensors are combined to three output signals of a virtual sensor by means of a freely definable averaging algorithm.
- The averaging takes place by means of the control system, which receives the six output signals of the two real magnetic field sensors via six inputs.
- The algorithm for combining the signals of the two real sensors and generating control signals for the compensation coils is described by a matrix multiplication.
- The control system uses independent control loops operating in parallel to process the virtual sensor signals and generate control signals for the compensation coils.
- The control loops may be broadband, selective concerning a frequency range, or selective concerning a frequency.
- If two compensation systems are operated directly beside each other, feedback effects may occur, which are accounted for by providing a 6×6 back coupling matrix C.
- The matrix S of the real sensor signals is expanded by the feedback part, and the virtual sensor signals are calculated from the expanded signals.
- The control signals are obtained by multiplying the matrix of virtual sensor signals with a 6×6 matrix L and the operator Ω.
</summary>

Additionally, the text mentions that the system is used to protect an object against influences of an interfering field, which is assumed to be a gradient field. The interfering field is measured by two real magnetic field sensors, and the output signals of these sensors are fed to the control unit. The control unit processes the signals according to a specific algorithm and generates control signals for six compensation coils. The system is designed to compensate both homogeneous and inhomogeneous magnetic fields and to perform a simulation of measuring electromagnetic interfering fields at the location of the object to be protected. The text also mentions problems with feedback effects when using two magnetic field compensation systems in immediate vicinity and the need for optimizing control systems for specific applications.

* The text describes an invention related to accelerating the effective subtraction operation in floating point units.
* The invention uses a difference between a subset of signals of the operand exponent arguments to begin subtraction of differences between operand fractions.
* The procedures are chosen such that when the complete operand argument difference is different from the subset operand argument difference, the correct result fraction is one of the operand fractions, which is available.
* The text outlines two procedures for effective subtraction operations based on the absolute value of the difference between the arguments of the exponents.
* When the absolute value of the difference is less than or equal to one, the alignment of the fractions can be performed without requiring a separate step before performing the subtraction.
* When the absolute value of the difference is greater than one, the larger operand is identified, and the subtraction operation can be performed to ensure a positive resultant quantity.
* The apparatus implementing the procedures includes units for determining the difference between the subset and complete exponent arguments, and logic units for selecting the appropriate procedure based on the difference results.

• The system eliminates the need for vial labels and associated printers and labor costs.

- The present invention provides a design rule checking system and method for accurately reporting errors for appropriate regions in a system that includes two different kinds of circuits, such as memory and logic.
- The method applies the right set of rules to the right regions of the mask pattern data by modifying standard logic rules to reflect the needs of particular memory regions.
- Customized design rules are created for each different type of region on the chip, based on pushing more liberal parameters onto stricter parameters contained in the standard Logic rules.
- The system can be applied to any mask pattern database, including one having no memory blocks, or even multiple types of memory blocks.
- Different types of memory are identified in the mask pattern data, such as with different memory ID layers, to ensure that design rule checker is able to correlate a particular region in a layer with a particular set of design rules.
- The invention checks different regions with different design rules, ensuring that all types of memory regions have to fulfill all memory rules of their group, and all logic regions have to fulfill logic and memory rules.
- The process is superior to prior art techniques in that it avoids false errors and is more reliable and efficient.
</summary>

• The text describes an invention for using waveguide holograms (WGHs) as improved illuminators for objects, particularly holograms and spatial light modulators (SLMs).
• WGHs have several advantages over conventional lens illumination systems, including occupying less space, reducing reflection losses, and eliminating stray light.
• However, WGHs have challenges such as alignment sensitivity, illumination depletion, two-sidedness, and light dispersion.
• Techniques for addressing these challenges include a priori and a posteriori compensation for illumination depletion, absorbing or reflecting unutilized light, and using polarization or phase modulation for SLM illumination.
• The text describes two methods for recording WGH gratings: a modified conventional holographic recording system and a system suitable for waveguides with more stringent requirements.
• The text also discusses experimental results, including the use of a white light illuminator and a coherent laser for illuminating a SLM, and the analysis of the quality of the reconstructed beams.

* The text describes a method and apparatus for non-destructively testing dynamoelectric machine rotors, specifically squirrel cage rotors for induction motors, to determine resistance, reactance, and effective electrical skew.
* The apparatus includes a test head with a magnetic core, primary windings, voltage pick-up coils, skew pick-up coils, and a current sensor. The test head rotates the rotor within a magnetic field, inducing voltages and magnetic flux that are sensed by the pick-up coils and current sensor.
* The data acquisition and processing system acquires and processes the voltage, current, and skew signals to calculate power values, resistance, reactance, and effective skew. The system also determines statistical information and stores the results on a Winchester magnetic disk.
* The control processor compares the calculated values to predetermined threshold values and determines pass/fail indications. The system displays the results on a display and prints them on a printer. The rotor is held in place during testing by a clutch mechanism that compresses o-rings when the rotor is in the retracted position.

* The text describes a method for granting managed applications access to native resources of an operating system while maintaining security by validating digital certificates associated with the managed library and managed application.
* The method includes the manager receiving a request from a managed application to access a native system resource through a managed library, authorizing the request based on the digital certificate of the managed library, and the managed library sending a request to access the native system resource to a runtime host.
* The runtime host then accesses the native system resource on behalf of the managed library.
* The text also describes an alternative method where the native system resource is accessed through a platform invoke.
* The method can be used in a closed mobile device environment to provide some level of security while allowing third-party code to execute.

* The invention provides an identification card with an internal antenna and integrated circuit chip sandwiched between two shock-absorbing layers, which are then laminated between two rigid outer layers.
* The card uses a core layer made of a silica-filled polyolefin, an alkyd resin spid with an anti-binding agent, and a bottom sheet also made of a silica-filled polyolefin. The core layer and bottom sheet are bonded together with adhesive layers and the electronic components are secured in place.
* The card is then laminated with two transparent polymer layers to provide mechanical strength and protect the image-receiving layer. The image-receiving layer can be formed using dye diffusion thermal transfer or inkjet printing methods.

<summary>

- The present invention relates to implementing a FIFO-type queue in a functional memory using a tree-shaped structure.
- In a typical implementation, a FIFO queue is implemented using a double-ended list, but this method is ineffective for functional memories due to the copy-on-write updating procedure.
- The invention uses a tree-shaped data structure where additions and deletions are directed to the first non-full node on the first edge and leaf nodes remain at the same hierarchy level.
- Each update requires time and space that are logarithmically dependent on the length of the queue.
- The node to be updated is easy to access by following the edge of the tree to a leaf node.
- A header node is added to the structure, which has three elements: one for the end of the queue, one for the middle part, and one for the beginning of the queue.
- Additions and deletions are made in a constant time and space by inverting the queue by changing the value of a bit in the header node.
- The header node makes use of an identifier indicating which separate nodes constitute the beginning and end of the queue.
- The queue can be used as a double-ended queue (deque) by adding or deleting from both ends.
- The invention can be implemented in a memory arrangement with an actual memory, intermediate registers, control logic, and input/output registers.
</summary>

* The invention utilizes DRAM storage capacitors as EPROM coupling capacitors and manufactures them with identical procedures, allowing for higher gate coupling ratios and reduced operation voltages, as well as the possibility of re-programmable redundancy circuits with smaller area and higher performance.

<summary>
• The text describes a method for determining the optimum values of feedback gains (P, I, and D) used in feedback control systems.
• Feedback control is commonly used to move an automatic guidance vehicle (AGV) along a predetermined course.
• The text discusses the limitations of a prior art method called the limit sensitivity process for determining feedback gains.
• The invention presents a new method for determining feedback gains that allows for easy and accurate determination of the proper value, irresestpive of the kind of subject of control.
• The method involves provisionally determining a feedback gain, executing feedback control using that gain, detecting an error, calculating an evaluation value based on the error, and repeating the process with a new feedback gain value until a suitable evaluation value is obtained.
• The evaluation value is calculated based on the length of the curve obtained by plotting the error against the time axis for the proportional gain, the integral of the error for the integral gain, and the integral of the absolute value of the error for the differential gain.
• The method allows for the calculation of feedback gains that provide for satisfactory stability, accuracy, and response in the feedback control system.
</summary>

The text describes a new method for determining the optimum values of feedback gains (P, I, and D) used in feedback control systems. The method is particularly useful for moving an automatic guidance vehicle (AGV) along a predetermined course, but it can be applied to other types of control systems as well. The text discusses the limitations of a prior art method called the limit sensitivity process for determining feedback gains and presents a new method that allows for easy and accurate determination of the proper value of feedback gains, irrespective of the kind of subject of control. The method involves provisionally determining a feedback gain, executing feedback control using that gain, detecting an error, calculating an evaluation value based on the error, and repeating the process with a new feedback gain value until a suitable evaluation value is obtained. The evaluation value is calculated based on the length of the curve obtained by plotting the error against the time axis for the proportional gain, the integral of the error for the integral gain, and the integral of the absolute value of the error for the differential gain. The method allows for the calculation of feedback gains that provide for satisfactory stability, accuracy, and response in the feedback control system.

- The invention relates to a method and device for detecting elementary particles, enabling both the detection of individual particles and the integration of their signals without knowing the count or signal rates in advance.
- The method involves discharging the detector on the low-voltage side, allowing for simpler distinction of small-size signals and preventing leakage current in high-voltage cables.
- The device includes a detector, a first, fast amplifier for amplifying individual signals, a second, slow amplifier for integrating signals upon exceeding a threshold value, and a support capacitor for compensating detector discharge at high beam rates.
- The signals are separated by capacitors, high-pass filters, inductive elements, or low-pass filters to enable separate detection and integration of signals.
- The invention can be used for detecting particles in particle accelerators, reactor installations, diagnostic devices, and other applications.
- The detector material can be doped or coated with a converter material for detecting uncharged particles.
- The use of a fast charge transport material like diamond as the detector material enables fast and reliable detection and integration of signals.
- The invention can be used for detecting packets of particles, summing up their pulse heights for overall particle rate assessment.
</summary>

<summary>
• The text describes an improved apparatus for automatically spin checking a driven disc assembly for friction clutches.
• The apparatus includes a stationary ring, a movable ring, a torque motor, and a servo motor.
• The driven disc assembly is mounted between the two rings and is frictionally engaged when the movable ring is moved towards the stationary ring.
• The distance between the rings is measured by an electronic sensor when the driven disc assembly is engaged.
• The torque motor is then energized to exert a predetermined torque on the driven disc assembly, attempting to rotate it against the frictional force generated by the rings.
• The movable ring is gradually moved away from the stationary ring to reduce the frictional force, and the driven disc assembly begins to rotate when the frictional force decreases enough.
• The distance separating the rings at the time of rotation is measured and compared with a standard value to determine if the driven disc assembly is excessively warped.
• If the driven disc assembly is within specified tolerances, the servo motor is actuated to allow the operator to remove it for installation of another assembly.
• If the driven disc assembly is defective, the operator is alerted, and the servo motor is actuated to permit removal of the defective assembly.
</summary>

<summary>
• The text describes a method and software for estimating the age of a person from their image using a face age-estimation system.
• The system uses a contourlet appearance model (CAM) algorithm to extract features from the image and applies an age classifier and aging functions to determine the age group and estimate the age.
• The CAM algorithm models both the shape and texture of the face, making it robust against noise and suitable for extracting age-related features.
• The age classifier uses support vector regression to construct differently-calibrated aging functions for youth and adults.
• The system can distinguish between youths and adults based on their feature vectors and use appropriate aging functions to estimate their ages.
• The estimated ages can be provided in the form of a single age or age indicator with a confidence factor or as a set of ages with corresponding confidence factors.
• The text also mentions the use of machine-readable storage media and various computer components, such as a processor, memory, storage device, input device, network interface device, video display adapter, and peripheral interface.
• The system can be implemented on a computing system, such as a computer, and can be used in various applications, including automated control and surveillance systems, homeland security technologies, and customer relationship management.
• The text emphasizes the importance of accurately and efficiently estimating ages from images, as it can benefit businesses and security systems, among others.
</summary>

• The present invention relates to a matrix display device for merging and displaying two images with different definitions.
• The matrix display device includes a controller and a matrix of pixels organized in a mosaic of identical arrangements, where each arrangement has pixels dedicated to displaying the first image and pixels dedicated to displaying the second image.
• Each arrangement can have different numbers of pixels dedicated to each image, and the pixels can emit different colors.
• The controller can apply attenuation functions to the light intensity signals of the pixels based on their intensity values to preserve the definition of the higher definition image while merging the two images.
• The remaining pixels of the display device can be configured to display two colors that restore the color associated with the first pixel.
• The invention can be applied to various types of display devices, including OLED, LED, and LCD, and can be used to merge images from different sensors, such as night vision, infrared, X-ray, and symbology.

• An imaging device, such as a xerographic machine, enters sleep mode when inactive to save energy.
• The toner used in the imaging device is charged with a tribo-electro-static charge.
• A toner concentration sensor measures the concentration of toner in the developer by detecting the tribo charge of the toner.
• If the imaging device is inactive for a long period, the toner's tribo charge decreases, affecting image quality.
• Exemplary embodiments include methods and apparatus for charging toner based on periods of inactivity and measuring toner charge levels.
• The relationship between inactivity time and tribo charge decay is approximated by a power law.
• User usage patterns are determined to predict next usage and calculate decay.
• The toner is charged to a predetermined level based on decay calculations.
• The methods can be implemented in software or hardware.

* The invention is about locating and tracing concealed elongated conductive objects, especially when they are adjacent to each other.
* The system includes a transmitter with a pair of antennae and a receiver that senses magnetic fields associated with the currents induced in the objects by the transmitter.
* The transmitter generates distinguishable alternating currents in the objects, and the receiver produces an output signal based on the sensing of both magnetic fields.
* The invention optimizes the positioning of the transmitter to produce two distinct output signal nulls over the respective objects, making tracing easier and more accurate.
* The system can use different carrier frequencies, amplitude modulation, or pulsing to make the currents distinguishable.
* The invention is particularly effective in environments where the horizontal separation between the objects is related to their depth and the field from the transmitter decreases by the inverse cube of the distance, reducing the inducement of currents from both antennae in the same object.

• The text describes an invention for interfacing a speaker phone with a telephone network to enable automatic answering and hands-free communication.
• The invention includes a power source, selective switch means, a coupler for automatically connecting the telephone network to the speaker phone, and a timer for limiting the duration of the call.
• Two embodiments are presented: one using an optocoupler and the other using a neon lamp and photocell.
• The optocoupler-based embodiment uses a charging capacitor and a timer to answer the call automatically and disconnect it after a set time. The user can also extend the call duration by pressing a switch.
• The neon lamp-based embodiment uses a photocell relay to connect the speaker phone to the telephone network when the phone rings. A timer is used to disconnect the call after a set time, and the user can extend the call duration by pressing a switch.
</summary>

The text describes an invention for interfacing a speaker phone with a telephone network to enable automatic answering and hands-free communication. The invention includes a power source, selective switch means, a coupler for automatically connecting the telephone network to the speaker phone, and a timer for limiting the duration of the call. Two embodiments are presented: one using an optocoupler and the other using a neon lamp and photocell.

• The optocoupler-based embodiment uses a charging capacitor and a timer to answer the call automatically and disconnect it after a set time. The user can also extend the call duration by pressing a switch.
• The neon lamp-based embodiment uses a photocell relay to connect the speaker phone to the telephone network when the phone rings. A timer is used to disconnect the call after a set time, and the user can extend the call duration by pressing a switch.

The optocoupler-based embodiment works by using an optocoupler to detect the telephone ringing signal and trigger the charging of a capacitor. When the capacitor is charged to a certain level, the timer is triggered, which in turn activates the speaker phone and connects it to the telephone network. The user can press a switch to extend the call duration beyond the set time.

The neon lamp-based embodiment uses a neon lamp and a photocell to detect the telephone ringing signal.

<summary>

- The present invention is a system for reducing or eliminating undersea optical repeaters in a trunk and branch ring network by replacing repeaters with remotely pumped optical amplifiers and supplying energy to those optical amplifiers over the same branch cables that distribute communications signals.
- The system includes an optical fiber cable trunk in ring topology with one or more telecommunications hubs, branching units, and branch fiber optic cables.
- The branch fiber optic cable is used to transmit optical energy at a wavelength other than the signal wavelength to power an optical amplifier located in the branch fiber optic cable, the optical fiber cable trunk, or the branching unit.
- The hub assembly also utilizes a similar arrangement to deliver light energy to remotely located optical amplifiers.
- The trunk and branch structure with a ring geometry exhibits strong survivability features, maintaining full connectivity along the trunk and to all cable stations via their respective branch fiber optic cables, and isolating cable station branches without compromising ring integrity.
- The system respects sovereignty concerns in undersea communications networks, accommodates reconfigurable wavelength add/drop branching units, and reduces capital and operating costs through repeaterless technology.
- The system can be applied to other methods of signal multiplexing and used as a terrestrial communications system instead of in an undersea application.
</summary>

* The invention uses a speaking rate threshold based on a listener's proficiency with the language being spoken and notifies the speaker through a wearable device with sensory mechanisms like vibration, beep, blink, or speech.
* The device can be a wearable smartphone, integrated into a teleprompter, or a portable device worn by the listener with a noticeable sensory mechanism.
* The device includes a microphone, sensory mechanism, speaking rate processor, language detector, speech clarity processor, comprehension comparator, and wireless transceiver.
* The method involves detecting a discourse language, determining a speaking rate, comparing it to a speaking rate threshold, and notifying the speaker to slow down when necessary. The threshold can be based on the listener's language proficiency or estimated listening rate.

* The invention describes a device for optical recording of rapid processes using a TV camera with means for deviating and suppressing the beam to scan over N lines of a picture plane.
* The device includes a cyclic line counter, a sawtooth generator synchronized with the counter output, and a delay device to control the vertical deviation of the beam and beam suppression circuit.
* The counter and sawtooth generator are synchronized, and the delay time of the delay device is selectable, allowing for higher picture sequence frequencies and flexible resolution in time.
* The device can be used for recording and analyzing rapid processes, with the video signals being digitized and stored for analysis, and the gaps between lines filled by interpolation or repetition of information.

<summary>
• The present invention allows existing network devices to support multimedia capabilities without replacing them.
• It uses a blender software to initiate parallel voice and multimedia components for a call, with the signaling paths passing through and being controlled by the blender.
• The blender merges the signaling paths of the voice and multimedia components into a single signaling path and passes it to the multimedia server.
• The multimedia server maintains control over the signaling paths and bearer paths of the components.
• The invention is compatible with various network systems and protocols, including SIP and SIP-T.
• An Intelligent Network (IN) signal can be used to determine if a blended call is being handled and trigger the blender if necessary.
• The order of some steps in the process can be rearranged as needed.
</summary>

• The present invention relates to a content synchronization framework for connected devices that allows for contextual synchronization over various communication network topologies.
• The framework includes a central reference point, client devices, a network, and external partners. The client shares contextual information with the central reference point, which compiles bundle information based on the dynamic arbitrary attribute information provided in the request.
• The response from the central reference point contains bundles, each with properties that direct the client in understanding the content and properties of files, and may be compressed to save bandwidth and download time.
• The client device creates a delta list of all the files in the bundle that are different from local copies and downloads the files in the ordered delta list from various servers indicated in the bundles. Incomplete bundles are rejected, and synchronization continues where it left off during the previous, failed or disrupted session.

<summary>

- The present invention provides methods and systems for facilitating anonymous communication between a finder and owner of a lost or misplaced object.
- Owners can register their contact information and unique IDs associated with their possessions on a centralized database.
- Finders can access a website or virtual locale associated with a tag on a lost object to initiate communication with the owner using the unique ID.
- The system generates anonymous email addresses for both the finder and owner to maintain privacy.
- The system can also support communication through instant messaging and text messaging.
- The invention allows for timely and anonymous communication between the finder and owner, increasing the chances of returning lost items.
</summary>

<summary>
• The text describes a foil electron multiplier invention that uses a series of thin foils in an evacuated enclosure to multiply electrons in transmission stages.
• Each foil is given a voltage to accelerate secondary electrons towards the next foil and generate more secondary electrons, which continue to the next foil.
• The invention can be used for amplification of incident electron flux or particle detection in photomultiplier tubes and particle detectors.
• The gain of the foil electron multiplier is given by Equation 2, which includes the probability of incident particle transmission, transmission through the support grid, and secondary electron emission yield.
• The gain is maximized by maximizing electron transmission through the foil, transmission through the support grid, and secondary electron emission yield.
• The invention has advantages over conventional multipliers, such as a higher gain per multiplication stage, simpler fabrication process, lower cost, larger area coverage, and intrinsic rejection of ion feedback.
• The range of foil dimensions is from about 0.5 cm diameter to 2×4 cm2, and the preferred material is carbon.
• The thinner the foil, the lower the voltage required for secondary electrons to transit the subsequent foil.
• The foil electron multiplier was demonstrated to have a higher gain efficiency than conventional electron multipliers.
• The invention is not limited to the precise form disclosed and can be modified and varied as suited to the particular use contemplated.
</summary>

<summary>
• The 3-D Phenomenoscope invention uses signals to synchronize lens filters to lateral motion in motion pictures and control the 3-dimensional visual effect for the viewer.
• The signals are developed in real-time by the 3-D Phenomenoscope and do not require any alteration to the motion picture or control information placed in it.
• The invention uses a computer algorithm running on a computer processor within the 3-D Phenomenoscope to calculate synchronization events from a multiplicity of media frames.
• The preferred embodiment has no moving parts and no wire connections, and uses material that partially occludes or entirely clears in response to electronic signals.
• The 3-D Phenomenoscope allows any motion picture with sustained lateral motion to be viewed with the visual effect of 3-dimensions, regardless of the media format or viewing venue.
• The 3-dimensional visual effect is produced regardless of whether the motion picture was shot on regular or digital film.
• The invention overcomes problems with 3-dimensional motion pictures, such as production, projection, and viewing issues.
• The preferred embodiment uses a simple algorithm to identify passages of lateral movement in the motion picture that will display as a 3-dimensional effect when viewed using the 3-D Phenomenoscope.
• Other embodiments may use more complex algorithms to identify screen action that can benefit from a Pulfrich effect, and may utilize other substances and technologies to change the transparency of the lenses.
</summary>

* The present invention discloses a method and apparatus for dicing semiconductor wafers using pressure to mechanically separate individual die without using a wafer saw.
* The process involves forming trenches along scribe lines on the wafer and applying mechanical pressure to singulate the die.
* The apparatus includes a pad for supporting the wafer and a pressure mechanism to apply pressure for singulation. The wafer is supported by a ring during the process.

<summary>

- The present invention relates to a field emission display device with a protection structure that includes at least one reduction plate or electrode to deflect ionized gases away from the cathode and prevent burnout damage to field emission elements.
- The reduction plate or electrode is typically provided on the cathode and is negatively charged to attract positive nitrogen and oxygen ions, preventing them from contacting the cathode and inducing electrical surges.
- The protection structure can include multiple reduction plates or electrodes interspersed among field emission elements on the cathode to alter the discharge path of ionized gases and prevent current-induced burnout damage.
- The field emission display device can include a cathode with elongated, parallel cathode strips and multiple field emission elements provided on each strip. The protection structure includes multiple elongated reduction plates or electrodes that run parallel and adjacent to the cathode strips.
- The reduction plates can be fabricated on the cathode plate at the same time as the cathode strips using photolithography techniques.
- The protection structure can also include reduction plates arranged in a meshwork- or net-shaped pattern among the field emission elements.
</summary>

<summary>

- The present invention relates to an image sensor with multiple imaging planes, including one on a top surface and two on edge surfaces.
- The image sensor comprises a semiconductor substrate, image sensor elements with charge collection and transfer means and image sensing regions, and doped layers for guiding charge carriers towards the charge collection and transfer means.
- The substrate includes a bottom layer highly doped with a P-type material and an upper layer more lightly doped with a P-type material.
- Image sensor elements are arranged in rows and columns along the length of the sensor, and a P+ layer is formed between the image sensors and the substrate edges.
- The increased doping level in the P+ layers creates a barrier to electron movement, effectively guiding charge carriers back towards the middle of the substrate.
- Charge carriers generated by light impinging on the edge surfaces diffuse laterally and are collected by the CCDs located along the edges.
- The second embodiment of the invention extends the lightly-doped N-type regions to the edges, improving charge collection and reducing crosstalk.
- The image sensor can be used to simultaneously image multiple planes and can be used for color applications with red, green, and blue filters.
- The invention can be easily incorporated into various types of image sensors using compatible processing techniques.

</summary>

<summary>

- The text describes a home network system that allows devices to serve as both network master and slave nodes, with the master node performing network administrative functions and the slave nodes performing their nominal device functions.
- The master node can enter power save mode and transfer its network administrative functions to a slave node, minimizing power consumption and ensuring network administration.
- The text outlines a process for transferring network administrative functions from the master node to a slave node, including the master node sending data enabling the functions and the slave node becoming the new master node.
- The selection of the slave node to transfer the functions to can be based on visibility, intelligence/functional capabilities, or user selection.
- The slave node accepts the transfer request and receives the transferred functions to become the new master node.
- The text also mentions that when a device is activated and no network master node is found, it becomes the new master node and performs both network administrative and nominal device functions.
- The invention can be implemented in various ways, including powerline networks, wired or wireless networks, and Ethernet networks.
</summary>

• The invention describes an antenna array using at least four antennae arranged in two equi-spaced linear triplets perpendicular to a ground plane, with each triplet having unique spacing and height.
• The array uses radio receiver means to obtain information signals from each antenna, and logic means to derive quotient signals for each triplet, which are functions of the elevation angle but not the ground reflection coefficient.
• The invention can operate in both receive and transmit modes, providing unambiguous angle measurements and the ability to determine range, identity, and elevation angle of an object. The design aims for unambiguous angle measurements up to 7 degrees with high accuracy and resolution.

* The invention describes a high temperature polymeric seal support that directly surrounds and compresses the glass envelope of a subminiature lamp, providing a longer axial length seal, heat resistance, ease of handling, and increased resistance to invasion and chemical attack.
* The polymeric seal support is made of a non-thermally conducting material, such as a fluoroelastomer, and can be molded or bored out to fit the glass envelope and conductive base. It forms a liquid-tight seal around the glass envelope and abbreviated height one piece conductive base, eliminating the need for adhesive or cement and reducing the number of sealing points. Additionally, the use of a potting material underneath the glass envelope can further protect the lamp and improve insulation.

• The text describes a technique for realizing a Generalized Decision Feedback Equalizer (GDFE) Precoder for multi-user (MU) MIMO systems, which significantly reduces computational cost while maintaining capacity.
• The method relaxes the requirement for knowledge of the covariance matrix (S zz ) corresponding to "Least Favorable Noise" and provides a uniform framework for realizing a GDFE Precoder.
• The described implementation achieves significant improvement in computational cost over conventional GDFE Precoders.
• The text presents a method for configuring a GDFE Precoder in a base station of a MU-MIMO wireless system, including computing a filter matrix C and using it to compute the transmit filter matrix B, feedforward filter matrix F, and interference pre-cancellation matrix G.
• The text also describes an alternate method for computing the filter matrix C without using S zz .
• The text includes numerical examples illustrating the computation of various matrices involved in the design of GDFE Precoder using both methods.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a heat-dissipating fan and housing, which enlarge the intake airflow area without modifying assembling conditions.
• The housing includes an outer frame with a passage for guiding air streams, and an sidewall of the passage extends radially outwardly to enlarge intake or discharge area for the air streams.
• The sidewall of the passage can extend radially outwardly with respect to a central or longitudinal axis of the passage and beyond the peripheral edge of the outer frame.
• The sidewall of the passage can be formed with an inclined portion or beveled edge to enlarge intake area for lateral side air streams.
• The heat-dissipating device includes an impeller and housing, where the housing has a passage for guiding air streams and an sidewall of the passage at least one opening side extends radially outwardly to enlarge intake/discharge area for the air streams.
• The blade dimension of the impeller increases along with the radially outwardly extending direction of the sidewall of the passage.
• The housing includes an air inlet, air outlet, and passage, and the sidewall of the passage at the air inlet side extends radially outwardly to enlarge intake area for the air streams.
• The heat-dissipating system includes a casing, electrical elements, and a heat-dissipating device, where the housing of the heat-dissipating device includes a passage and an sidewall of the passage at one opening extends radially outwardly with respect to the rotational axis of the heat-dissipating device.
• The heat-dissipating device can be an axial fan and includes a heat sink assembled with the housing.
• The invention enlarges the intake/discharge area for the air streams, increasing the heat-dissipating efficiency of the fan, and concentrating the air streams to the central portion of the heat sink for enhanced heat-dissipating effects.
</summary>

* The present invention provides an electroluminescent display panel that can display different colors without using an intermediate electrode, allowing for a simpler and more cost-effective design.
* The display panel consists of a first luminescent layer emitting green light and a second luminescent layer overlapping the first layer, which emits orange light to create lemon light when both layers are activated. The second luminescent layer can be eliminated and replaced with a color filter to emit yellow or other colors.

• The text describes a communications terminal for Internet/network telephony that uses wireless near field communication to establish a connection to a network or the Internet, allowing for mobility and independence from specialized equipment.
• The terminal includes audio means, converting means, protocol means, and wireless communications means, and may communicate additional information and/or data with the connecting unit. The system comprises a portable communications terminal, a connecting unit, and a service server, and allows for centralized handling and control of connections between users, as well as additional services and functionalities.

<summary>

- Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric materials are convenient for semiconductor circuitry but have issues with reactivity and formation of low dielectric constant layers when integrated with Si or metals.
- Ge buffer layers can prevent or minimize the formation of low dielectric constant layers and enhance epitaxy, making it easier to deposit high-dielectric constant oxides on Si or metal.
- Ge has a smaller free energy of oxidation and is thermodynamically stable next to some high-dielectric constant oxides like BT and ST.
- SrTiO 3 or other stable ferroelectrics can be used as buffer layers between Pb containing ferroelectrics and Ge or Si substrates to act as a chemical barrier and nucleate the desired perovskite structure.
- A second ferroelectric layer can be used as a chemical buffer layer to improve properties such as diffusion barrier, nucleation, and leakage current.
- ST, BST, and BT have large dielectric constants which help share the electric field and are preferred for buffer layers.
- Epitaxial Ge buffer layers have been used to deposit epitaxial BST on Si substrates, preventing the formation of low dielectric layers at the interface.
- A MOS transistor with a ferroelectric layer instead of SiO 2 as the gate insulator can be used as a non-volatile, non-destructive readout memory.
- A Ge buffer layer allows many stable ferroelectrics to be used in a RAM, and a second buffer layer of SrTiO 3 or other stable ferroelectrics can allow even chemically reactive ferroelectric oxides to be used.
- Ge is the only material that reacts neither with semiconductor substrates nor high-dielectric constant oxides at the required annealing temperatures and provides for epitaxial growth of conductive or semiconductive materials on a semiconductor substrate.
</summary>

* The invention provides a receiver input circuit with multiple amplification control loops to eliminate unwanted signal actuation of non-linear components, ensuring adequate small signal behavior and using conventional components.
* The first and second control loops avoid overloading of the mixer stage and varactor diodes, and control amplification in the input network. The third control loop supports the other control circuits and lowers amplification in the presence of strong spurious signals.

<summary>
• The invention relates to setting up a collaborative work-share environment between parties during a telephone call without complex setup processes.
• Each party has a collaboration button and indicator on their telephone set.
• When the indicator is illuminated, network-enabled applications can be run on individual users' desktop computers for sharing information and conducting video conferences.
• The telephone is used for regular voice-only calls, and the phones communicate to determine collaboration capabilities.
• If both parties have common collaboration application programs, the indicator is illuminated, and collaboration can be initiated by pushing the collaboration button.
• The voice path remains unaffected during collaboration.
• The invention can be applied to a LAN or the Internet, and can be used with various types of telephones and collaboration applications.
• The invention can be implemented in various ways, including peer-to-peer architecture and one-wire-to-the-desktop configurations.
</summary>

* The present invention optimizes the visual impact of an advertising clip inserted into a video sequence by accounting for the regions of interest of the video sequence and the advertising clip, ensuring continuity between them.
* The method involves generating salience maps for the video sequence and each advertising clip, determining the degree of similarity between them using various methods, and selecting the clip with the highest degree of similarity to insert at the insertion point in the video sequence.

<summary>
• The text describes an invention related to reducing high electrical fields and leakage at intersections in very small semiconductor devices, particularly in the sub-250 nanometer range.
• The invention involves using a recessed mask structure to protect the dielectric material and reduce lateral leakage between adjacent metal lines.
• The mask is positioned below the surface to be planarized, where there is a lower electric field, to protect the dielectric and maintain its integrity.
• The invention is useful in damascene type device structures, where conductive regions are lined with a conductive diffusion barrier and insulated by an intralevel dielectric material.
• The recessed mask structure results in a lower effective dielectric constant than a conventional structure and reduces overall capacitance, leading to faster signal propagation in interconnect wiring.
• The invention can be implemented using various materials, including hard masks and inorganic intralevel dielectrics, and can be achieved through unique etching processes.
</summary>

The text describes an invention for reducing high electrical fields and leakage at intersections in very small semiconductor devices, particularly in the sub-250 nanometer range. The invention involves using a recessed mask structure to protect the dielectric material and reduce lateral leakage between adjacent metal lines. The mask is positioned below the surface to be planarized, where there is a lower electric field, to protect the dielectric and maintain its integrity. The invention is useful in damascene type device structures, where conductive regions are lined with a conductive diffusion barrier and insulated by an intralevel dielectric material. The recessed mask structure results in a lower effective dielectric constant than a conventional structure and reduces overall capacitance, leading to faster signal propagation in interconnect wiring. The invention can be implemented using various materials, including hard masks and inorganic intralevel dielectrics, and can be achieved through unique etching processes.

* The text describes an invention for a downconverting analog-to-digital converter that utilizes predictive coding principles to eliminate complexities introduced by discrete-time analog circuitry and enhance the converter's dynamic range and noise performance.
* The invention places the sampler inside the predictive loop, allowing the predictive filter to be implemented using digital signal processing techniques and eliminating the need for discrete-time analog circuitry.
* The predictive filter output is re-mapped into the analog domain using a digital-to-analog converter and subtracted from the input analog signal to generate the prediction error signal, which is then directly sampled and converted to digital representation.
* The invention also includes the use of a digital quadrature mixer, automatic gain control loop, and offset nuller loop to further improve the converter's performance.

<summary>

- The text describes a method for fabricating arrays of nano-scale features on a single wafer using nanoimprint lithography for sensing applications.
- The method involves defining groups of semiconducting nanotraces between electrodes, which can be used as sensors or for multiplex detection of analytes.
- Nanoimprint lithography provides a cost-effective and time-efficient method for fabricating arrays of semiconducting electrode "nanotraces" in a controllable and regular pattern.
- The fabricated nanotraces have dimensions on the order of electrical diffusion pathways and large surface-to-volume ratios, making them highly sensitive to local environmental changes.
- The local environment can be a gas phase, solution, or solid, and the response is proportional to the degree in which the electrical current traversing the set of semiconductor nanotraces is influenced by changes in the electric field strength near the surface.
- The method involves preparing the electrical base including the semiconductor nanotraces for the multiplex detection array, preparing the imprint pattern for the semiconductor nanotraces, and etching the semiconductor nanotraces.
- The fabricated semiconductor nanotraces are then functionalized with sensitizing compounds, such as probe molecules, to make the sensor devices unique and responsive to specific targets.
- The method can be used for various applications, including diagnostic tests for virulent pathogens, detection of specific RNA or DNA sequences, and detection of entities on surfaces.

</summary>

* The present invention relates to a method of singulating and plating semiconductor packages, involving plating the side surfaces of leads to prevent contamination.
* The method includes providing a plurality of semiconductor dies coupled to a leadframe, singulating the dies, and plating the exposed side surfaces of the leads with a different material than the leads.
* The leads can be copper, and the plating material can be a metallic material such as tin, silver, gold, nickel-gold, nickel-palladium, or nickel-palladium-gold.
* The leadframe can be singulated using full or partial cutting, with the plating process performed before or after the singulation step.
* The side surfaces of the semiconductor package can have a step or beveled portion formed from the plating material.
* The method can be used to form semiconductor packages with straight or beveled side surfaces.

* The invention describes a method for a mobile terminal to select a serving base station of a wireless wide area network (WWAN) in a communication system that contains WWAN, WLAN, and the mobile terminal.
* The WLAN has a second base station for gathering service information of the first base stations, which is transmitted to the mobile terminal when it connects to the WLAN.
* The mobile terminal uses the service information to skip some initial scanning procedures when connecting to the WWAN, accelerating the connecting process.
* The invention also provides a fallback mechanism for the mobile terminal to scan the first base stations if it fails to connect using the service information.

• The text describes a new process for producing multilayered components, such as capacitors, eliminating steps 4 and 6 of the conventional process, which include cutting and metallizing.
• The process involves providing first and second electrical component and electrode sub-assemblies, which are then stacked to form a resultant assembly.
• Multiple electrodes and components are formed on decals using screening processes, and the components are allowed to cure before the sub-assemblies are brought into mutually stacked relation and the carriers are removed.
• The new process allows for smaller parts, lower voltage ratings, no shape limitations, enhanced in-process inspection, elimination of cutting stress cracks, elimination of internal delamination, lower labor content per part, and end terminations of electrodes that enable provision of a variety of tab configurations.
• The process is adaptable to other electronic ceramic devices, such as multilayer ferrite inductors, multilayer substrates, semiconductor packages, and precision registers.
• The new process results in a more reliable part for high reliability requirements and reduces the number of steps and labor required to manufacture parts.

<summary>

• The text describes a sandwich panel core made of a hierarchical lattice structure with synergistically arranged trusses.
• The lattice structure results in a hollow core, maintaining a low weight while providing high specific stiffness and strength.
• Sandwich panels have various applications, including transportation, ballistics, blast and impact mitigation, thermal transfer, multifunctional structures, armors, and containers.
• An aspect of the invention includes a structure with a primary array and an ancillary array, where the ancillary array is nested with the primary array, and the second order cells of the ancillary array are essentially coaligned with the second order cells of the primary array or the first order cells of the primary array.
• Another aspect includes a method of making a structure by forming a primary array with a first primary array and an ancillary array, nesting the ancillary array with the first primary array, and mating the second primary array with the first primary array to form a third lattice structure.
• The lattice structures can be made from various materials, including metals, polymers, ceramics, and composites.
• The lattice structures can be fabricated using various methods, such as injection molding, casting, or textile lay-up techniques.
• The text references several related patent applications and patents.
• The text also mentions that the lattice structures can be used in various applications, including blast and impact mitigation, heat exchange, and multifunctional structures.
• The text emphasizes that the invention is not limited to the specific embodiments described and that many modifications and variations are possible.
</summary>

* The invention describes a process for co-producing power and hydrocarbons using an Integrated Gasification Combined Cycle (IGCC) plant and a coal-to-liquid (CTL) facility. The process includes wet and dry gasification stages, hydrogen enrichment, power generation, and hydrocarbon synthesis.
* The wet gasification stage produces combustion gas at high pressure with a high hydrogen content, which is then enriched with hydrogen and used to generate power in the IGCC plant. The dry gasification stage produces synthesis gas precursor at lower pressure, which is mixed with the hydrogen-enriched gas and used for hydrocarbon synthesis in the CTL facility. The process also includes CO2 removal, water treatment, and the sharing of utilities and air separation units between the IGCC and CTL facilities.

• The present invention relates to a method for preparing a superconducting device using oxide superconducting materials, with a focus on preventing the removal of oxygen from the surface or portion close to the surface to maintain ideal oxygen concentration and reliability.
• A blocking film or passivation film is uniformly coated over the spaces or micro-holes in the surface portion of the superconducting material using a photo CVD method.
• Oxygen is added to the surface or portion close to the surface and positioned in the appropriate atom location through heat treatment and conversion to a highly dense insulating material.
• The films used for this purpose can be insulating films such as silicon nitride, aluminum nitride, oxidized aluminum, oxidized tantalum, oxidized titanium, or oxidized metal or semiconductor materials.
• The method is applicable to various oxide superconducting materials, including those formed into tablets or thin films, and can be used to create a passivation film or a Josephson element structure.

* The present invention is an apparatus for preparing foam sheet samples for microscopic examination, allowing for precise and uniformly thin cross-sectional specimens to be prepared.
* The apparatus includes a base plate, clamping arrangement, and a threaded member with a hand nut for advancing the foam sheet sample and making linearly oriented parallel cuts. The design enables the preparation of repetitive samples with very parallel cut edges for microscopic examination.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a method and apparatus for determining the angle of inclination of a seismometer, especially an ocean bottom seismometer (OBS), and for leveling its seismic motion detectors.
• Seismometers, including OBSs, are used in geological research, particularly for oil and natural gas exploration. OBSs are designed for remote operation on the ocean floor and require a method for determining their angle of inclination and leveling their seismic motion detectors.
• The invention uses a seismometer with a spherical ball and a geophone suspended from it, forming a simple pendulum. The geophone's vertical operating axis is aligned with the vertical when the seismometer is in its normal, up-right position.
• The invention includes a plunger with a spring-loaded head that locks the spherical ball, shaft, and geophone in their positions once the seismometer has been deployed and stabilized.
• The detector, support means, solenoid, and plunger are mounted to the door of a water-tight instrument housing, providing a rigid connection from the detector to the frame and the ocean floor.
• The invention also includes a method and apparatus for automatically leveling seismic motion detectors employed as the pendulum weight.
• The invention provides a simple and inexpensive method for determining the angle of inclination of a recoverable device, such as a seismometer, and preserving its orientation for later measurement.
• The invention also provides a mounting and clamp for a seismic motion detector that provides good acoustic coupling between the ocean bottom and the detector.
• The invention can be used with various types of seismic motion detectors, including vertical and horizontal types, and can be constructed using suitable materials and techniques for transmitting seismic vibrations without dampening or filtering.
</summary>

• The present invention describes a humidity sensing element made of a tubular aluminum first electrode, anodized and impregnated with nickel particles, and a second electrode formed by vacuum-deposited nickel on the sealed anodized layer.
• The sensor is manufactured by anodizing the aluminum, depositing nickel particles in the porosity of the anodized layer, hydrolizing and sealing the anodized layer, and depositing a thin, water vapor pervious second electrode.
• The sensor functions by combining capacitance and resistance in a way that its impedance varies linearly with the relative humidity of the atmosphere, making it suitable for use in commercial humidity controls.

<summary>

- The text describes a motor assembly for a window lift system, which includes a motor, a gear train, and a force transmission structure.
- The force transmission structure consists of a drive plate and a shaft.
- The drive plate has a Y-shaped mounting hole with three sections, and the shaft has a toothed portion with three teeth that fit into the sections of the mounting hole.
- The drive plate also has a coupling, protrusions, and ribs.
- The coupling has buffer holes between adjacent sections, and the protrusions engage with the damper's second slots.
- The drive plate is preferably made of a plastics material, and the damper is made of rubber.
- The worm gear has ribs that fit into the damper's first slots, and the protrusions on the drive plate fit into the damper's second slots.
- The shaft is held captive within the mounting hole by a circlip.
- The use of a Y-shaped mounting hole and toothed portion, as well as the buffer holes and the material choice, improve the stability, torque capacity, and noise reduction of the motor assembly.
</summary>

• The present invention provides a method and system for generating a mobile time reference for a portable transceiver using a high frequency oscillator and a low frequency oscillator.
• The mobile time reference is maintained using the low frequency oscillator during idle mode and switched to the high frequency oscillator during active mode.
• The invention includes a free running counter that generates the mobile time reference and maintains it during idle mode using the low frequency oscillator, and updates it using the high frequency oscillator when the transceiver transitions to active mode.

* The text describes an individually fitted helmet liner that can be rapidly and simply fitted to a wearer's head and refitted to accommodate changed head sizes.
* The liner consists of a plurality of elastic thermoplastic sheets with open pockets, arranged in superposed contacting relationship with one another.
* The liner is fitted to a wearer's head by heating the sheets to a plastic state, placing the liner between an outer fixture and the wearer's head, and removing the liner when it has cooled to a rigid, nonplastic state.
